title: white_album_(stand)
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|]] in [[Vento Aureo]].

Namesake is the ninth studio album of the British rock band The Beatles, also titled [i]The Beatles[/i], but popularly known as the [i]White Album[/i] due to its cover, released on 22 November 1968.

title: hierophant_green
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Kakyoin Noriaki]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a green humanoid that can unravel into a very long elastic membrane.

It's capable of moving long distances from Kakyouin without losing power, along with being able to control other people like a marionette. Its strongest ability is a projectile attack named Emerald Splash.

Name is based on [i]The Hierophant[/i] [[tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.
other_names: 法皇の緑(ハイエロファントグリーン)
ハイエロファントグリーン

title: kars_(jojo)
body:
Main antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 2. Leader of the Pillar Men, ancient vampires vastly superior to those created by the [[stone mask (jojo)|Stone Mask]], which he invented. He has three [[horns]] and [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair]] and his default attire has him [[topless male]], showing off his [[muscular|muscles]] and [[abs]].

Namesake is the American new wave band The Cars.
other_names: カーズ(ジョジョの奇妙な冒険)

title: iggy_(jojo)
body:
A supporting character from Part 3 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].  His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[The Fool]].

A [[Boston Terrier]] possessing human-like intelligence and a fondness for coffee-flavored chewing gum.
other_names: イギー(ジョジョの奇妙な冒険)

title: gnorts_(vinesauce)
body: An alien [[mascot]] featured on the channel of [[Vinny_(vinesauce)|Vinny Vinesauce]]. He originated from a stream of [[Slay the Spire]], during which Vinny found it amusing when an audience member pointed out that [[Neil Armstrong]]'s name backwards was "Gnorts Mr. Alien". Since then, Gnorts has become a recurring character on Vinny's streams.

title: the_fool
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Iggy (jojo)|]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. It bestows the power to manipulate sand to great effect.

Being made of sand, its form can vary widely. Its main form is somewhat like a car chassis, with the front wheels replaced by a pair of muscled arms, and a mask with feather-like objects sticking from its head.

Name is taken directly from [i]The Fool[/i] [[Tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.

title: hermit_purple
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. It manifests as multiple purple thorny vines that spawn from Joseph's right hand. 

Besides being prehensile, the Stand affords Joseph various psychic powers, such as being able to take a photograph of somebody across the world, or tracking something on a living map made out of dust.

Name is based on [i]The Hermit[/i] [[Tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.

title: magician's_red
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Mohammed Avdol]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Represented as a humanoid figure with a bird head, it has the power to manipulate fire.

Name is based on [i]The Magician[/i] [[tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.
other_names: 魔術師の赤(マジシャンズレッド)

title: king_crimson
body:
Progressive rock band formed in Dorset, England by guitarist Robert Fripp and drummer Michael Giles in 1968.
their debut album, [[In The Court Of The Crimson King]], is one of the band's most iconic works.

title: when_he's_copying_your_snaps_so_you_pull_this_move_(meme)
body:
When He's Copying Your Snaps So You Pull This Move or Boom Shakalaka Yess Gawd is a redraw meme trend based on a TikTok slideshow of a girl flexing her muscles so that the boy copying her Snapchat posts will also flex his muscles. The TikTok was originally posted by user @bostynbaker in December 2024 but has since been deleted. That month, a redraw of the slideshow was posted to X / Twitter, inspiring further redraws throughout December 2024 and January 2025.

https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/when-hes-copying-your-snaps-so-you-pull-this-move

title: cleft_of_venus
body:
The thin slit shape that forms the gap between the labia majora of some [[pussy|pussies]]. Should not be used when the labia minora is visible (e.g. post #5184055) or when the pussy is spread or gaping.

When [[skin tight]] clothing takes the shape of the cleft of venus, but the cleft itself is not visible, use [[cameltoe]] instead. The only time both can apply is when the clothing is [[see-through clothes|see-through]].

h4. Examples

* !post #733939

title: poke_ball
body:
Japanese name: モンスターボール (Monster Ball)

[i]You know, Poké Balls!
P-O-K-accent-E Balls![/i]

Known as a [i]Monster Ball[/i] in Japan, a spherical capsule used to capture and store [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] (Pocket Monsters). The most common and recognized Poké Ball is the titular basica variant, which has two colored halves: red on top and white on bottom.
It is one of the central symbols of the franchise.

Normally, captured Pokémon would be stored inside a "pocket dimension" within the ball, though some refuses to went inside the Poké Balls. [[ash ketchum|Ash]]'s [[Pikachu]] is a notable example.

[b]Note[/b]: Don't use [[ball]], [[holding_ball]] and related "ball" tags when the object in question is a Poké Ball. Simply use [[poke_ball]], [[holding_poke_ball]], etc.

h6. Actions/placement

* [[holding poke ball|Holding Poké Ball]]
* [[in poke ball|In Poké Ball]]
* [[throwing poke ball|Throwing Poké Ball]]

title: jinshi_(kusuriya_no_hitorigoto)
body:
Jinshi is the male lead of the series [[Kusuriya no Hitorigoto]].  Known as the beautiful eunuch of the rear palace, in-universe he is officially stated to be 23 at the start of the series.  Jinshi is described as possessing the beauty of a nymph that transcends gender and is usually depicted with [[long_hair|long]] [[black_hair|black]] to [[purple hair]], commonly worn with a [[bun_cover|covered]] [[hair bun]] in the back.[spoilers] After the events of volume 4, his face was marred with a [[scar_on_cheek|scar running down the side of his cheek]][/spoilers].

Jinshi officially is a eunuch who manages the Imperial harem in the rear palace.  Tasked with taking care of, monitoring, and evaluating the consorts who live within the rear palace's walls.  He is frequently accompanied by his attendant [[Gaoshun_(kusuriya_no_hitorigoto)|]].  He first formally meets [[Maomao_(kusuriya_no_hitorigoto)|]] when he took up the task of finding out the identity of the unknown benefactor who had left a note at high consort [[Gyokuyou_(kusuriya_no_hitorigoto)|]]'s palace that saved the life of her daughter.  He ends up developing an interest in her due to a mix of her intelligence, knowledge, and how she frequently is more likely to show him contempt instead of swooning over him like most people.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #19757497: Anime

title: banken_(inui_toko)
body:
A pair of [[dog]]-like companions to [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Inui Toko]].

The vast majority of the time they are just Inui's [[hair ornament]]s. Use this tag only when they appear in some other way.

They are individually named [[Ban (Inui toko)|]] and [[Ken (Inui Toko)|]], but are typically identical. Use those tags only when they can be identified.
For example, alongside [[Inui Toko (8th costume)|Inui's 8th costume]] they each get a [[hat]] with their name [[clothes writing|written]] on it, and in [[Page of Lambda]] they are [[personification|personified]] as [[dog girl]]s with different hairstyles.

title: fate/accel_zero_order
body:
[b]The Fourth Revelation: Fuyuki[br]Fate/Accel Zero Order[/b]
[quote]Japan, Fuyuki—
A new singularity has appeared on the site of Singularity F,
but at coordinates ten years prior.
The timeline sees a Fuyuki embroiled in the Fourth Holy Grail War.
Your guide for this Rayshift will be Lord El-Melloi II.
What has happened to the Fourth Holy Grail War?
A battle to discover the truth is about to begin...
[/quote]

A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Fate/Zero]] guest written by [[Urobuchi Gen]], released on the Japanese server on April 27, 2016 and on the NA server on April 19, 2018. The story is a retelling of the events of Fate/Zero with interference from Chaldea and [[Lord El-Melloi II]].

title: mizuki_(gegege_no_kitarou)
body:
[[GeGeGe no Kitarou]] character.

A human man who discovers [[Medama Oyaji]] and his wife [[Iwako (gegege no kitarou)|]] at the tail end of their lives, and eventually [[Kitarou]] after the latter is buried. He raised Kitarou for part of his childhood, but is also the reason Kitarou only develops one eye.

In [[Kitarou Tanjou: GeGeGe no Nazo]], he is familiar with the Kitarou family far before their natural deaths.

Developed on the planet Zebes, with the planet SR388 being their natural environment. Their prey ranges from just about anything that moves, but they are the only natural predator of [[X Parasite]]s.

title: imadake_dabuchi_tabemi
body:
A character introduced by [[McDonald's]] Japan to promote their limited edition Double Cheese burger, sold from late October to November 2024. Her name literally means "taste of double cheese just now".

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] styled in [[twintails]] and wears a [[red_hat|red]] [[visor cap]] with a large [[McDonald's]] logo visible from the front that's adorned with a [[headset]] and [[microphone]].

Her outfit is based on the old [[fast_food_uniform|McDonalds uniform]] from the 1990s featuring a [[white shirt]] with red [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical stripes]], topped off with a [[yellow happi]] with a bright red hem, which is secured with a red [[tasuki]] that's tied off into a large [[back_bow|bow on her back]].

Some further accents of her outfit are a [[black necktie]] with [[tie clip|tie clips]], two [[black wristband|black wristbands]], and a black [[button badge]] with the 今 kanji ([i]ima[/i], Eng: Now) which is the first syllable of her name.

Her bottom half consists of [[black shorts]], [[white socks]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]] with [[velcro_footwear|velcro]] fasteners. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8324932: Profile
* !post #8328754: Reference Sheet

* [[Imadake Dabuchi Tabesuke]]

title: amia_(andromedako_(akiyamamizuki))
body:
[[Andromedako (AkiyamaMizuki)]]'s [[original]] character.

The character has multiple versions that are self-inserts into different series, one being for [[Project Sekai]], and another for [[Limbus Company]] that the author [[oc x canon|yume-ships]] with [[Ishmael (project moon)|]] from the same game.

In both versions, the character has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]]. The Project Sekai version also has [[green hair|green]] or [[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in their hair and generally has it tied into a [[high ponytail]], while the Limbus Company version wears their hair loose and has darker pink [[colored tips|tips]].

The character's sheet lists their gender as nonbinary (Project Sekai version) or ??? (Limbus Company version), and their pronouns as they/them. As such, their gender should be tagged as [[1other]].

h4. External links
* "Toyhouse - character info (Project Sekai version)":[https://toyhou.se/11697136.amia-sona]
* "Toyhouse - character info (Limbus Company version)":[https://toyhou.se/27055807.amia-lcb-self-insert]

title: list_of_project_moon_identities
body:
Introduced in [[Leviathan (Project Moon)|]] and expanded upon within [[Limbus Company]], Identities are alternate forms of individuals from Mirror Worlds accessed by Mirror technology.

When using an Identity, the individual gains the equipment, skills, and personality of that identity. Limbus Company makes extensive use of this, allowing the Sinners to utilize different Mirror Worlds to their advantage in combat. 

Young-ji initially invented the Glass Window, which was further refined by [[Yi Sang (project moon)|]] into the Mirror. After the League of Nine Littérateurs collapsed, the remaining members spread out throughout the City with the Mirror technology. The technology quickly came into possession of the Wings, syndicates, and other groups of the City who began researching, experimenting and improving upon it.

[spoiler]As shown by [[Erlking Heathcliff (Project Moon)|]], Identities of different people can be either willingly or forcibly imposed onto others regardless of whether or not that Identity actually belongs to them.[/spoiler]

h4. List of official Identities

h6. Syndicates

* [[blade lineage (identity) (project moon)|Blade Lineage]]
* [[kurokumo clan (identity) (project moon)|Kurokumo Clan]]
* [[tingtang gang (identity) (project moon)|Tingtang Clan]]
* [[los mariachis (identity) (project moon)|Los Mariachis]]
* [[Twinhook Pirates (identity) (project moon)|Twinhook Pirates]]
* [[middle_(identity)_(project_moon)|The Middle]]

h6. Corporations

title: self_cosplay
body:
A character's variant [[cosplay|wearing the clothes]] of another variant of their own, such as a [[magical girl]]'s civilian identity wearing her magical girl identity's clothes.

Usually done when both variants have a recognizable hairstyle and/or hair color, so it's clear that the clothes they're wearing doesn't match the hair. The [[Precure]] franchise has an unofficial term for this, which is "midform".

Similar to [[fusion]] and [[split theme]], but instead of merging, the character looks more like they simply changed clothes.

If instead, the hairstyle doesn't match the state of the body, it might be a [[self-borrowed hairstyle]].

It consists of a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]] with a [[sparkle print]] and a [[hat bow|bow]], a [[black choker|black]] [[lace-trimmed choker]], a [[GuyRyS]] [[necklace]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[lace-trimmed dress|lace trim]], [[spaghetti strap]]s and [[empire waist]], an [[open cardigan|open]] [[brown cardigan|brown]]  [[cable knit]] [[hooded cardigan]] with [[puffy long sleeves]] and [[horns through hood|cutouts for her horns]], a [[black pantyhose]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. She also has a [[bracelet]], a [[wristwatch]], [[mismatched earrings|mismatched]] [[flower earrings]] and optional [[glasses]].

On April 2024 she got an optional [[black capelet|black]] [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[hooded capelet]] with a [[rabbit hood]] and a large [[pink bowtie]].

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this outfit:

title: self-borrowed_hairstyle
body:
A character's variant [[borrowed hairstyle|wearing the hairstyle]] of another variant of their own.

To distinguish from general [[self cosplay]]s, it must be clear that the hairstyle doesn't belong to the wearer's current body. Such as:

* The hairstyle's original hair color is different from the wearer's current hair color
* The hairstyle belongs to a younger version but the wearer has an older body, or vice versa
* Other mismatched traits such as eye color, scars, etc.

title: dual_persona
body:
Two different versions of the same character appearing together in the same scene. Example: [[Saber (fate)|]] & [[Saber Alter]].

If the picture depicts them as two distinct characters in the same scene, don't use [[solo]], [[1girl]] or [[1boy]] with this tag. Exceptions are [[split theme]], [[multiple views]], [[creature and personification]] and similar themes.

When the character is meeting their [[aged up|older]] or [[aged down|younger]] self, also tag [[age comparison]] if the personas have no interactions, or [[time paradox]] if the personas have interactions other than posing for the camera.

If the instances of the character are identical, use [[clone]] instead. If more than two personae are in one image, use [[multiple persona]] instead.



h4. See also

* [[age comparison]]
* [[dark persona]]
* [[doppelganger]]
* [[look-alike]]
* [[selfcest]]
* [[clone harem]]

title: torogao
body:
A facial expression where the character appears to be in an ecstatic, yet quiet and unresponsive trance with their face almost melting in pleasure.

The cheeks look [[blush|flushed]], the eyebrows are slanted downwards towards the sides, and the eyes are half-open and [[tears|moist]], often staring into the distance.
It is common to see [[saliva|drool]] and a [[open mouth|half-open mouth]] as well.  The limbs and joints may be relaxed and hanging loosely in place.

May also involve [[heavy breathing]] or a contented [[smile]].

h4. Examples
* !post #1164935

It is often sexual in nature, but not always. It may also be seen when a character is eating their favorite food, for example. 

Not to be confused with [[ahegao]], which is a more wild expression. Torogao indicates trance-like pleasure.

h4. See also
* [[fucked silly]]
* [[Tag Group:Face Tags]]

title: clone
body:
Two or more instances of the same character in the same scene. The instances should be completely identical and wearing the same outfit. 

Do not use this tag for a character who is a clone of another character, unless both are present in the scene.

Not to be mistaken for [[multiple_views]], where multiple images of the characters are independent, and do not react to one another, or inhabit a common environment.

title: m1_bazooka
body:
The [b]M1 Bazooka[/b] is an American anti-tank [[rocket launcher]] developed by the [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] and approved for service in 1940, the M1 Bazooka was the first of its kind: using a rocket (rather than an anti-tank rifle or a handheld grenade) to shoot a shaped charge at enemy tanks. The Bazooka saw extensive use on all fronts of the war, used against enemy bunkers, pillboxes, fortified positions, and even tanks. 

After the disastrous Battle of Kasserine Pass in early 1943, many examples of the Bazooka fell into German hands. Impressed with the innovative idea, the Germans copied the Bazooka wholesale, enlarging the rocket and adding a shield to the tube to protect the shooter from backblast, calling the new weapon the [[panzerschreck]], or "tank terror".

The name "Bazooka" originated from its shape, which bears similarity to the tubular musical instrument invented and popularized by U.S. radio comedian Bob Burns in the 1930s. It is now used as a generic term for any manner of tube-like shoulder-fired rocket launcher, but that's not what this Danbooru tag should be used for. This tag specifically covers the original M1 Bazooka model; for a generic rocket launcher, use [[rocket launcher]] tag instead.

h4. See also

* [[rocket launcher]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

* [[bazooka_(gundam)]]
* [[yae_bazooka]]
* [[chrysm_bazooka]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Bazooka":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bazooka

title: new_jersey_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class battleship [i]USS New Jersey[/i] (BB-62). Character design by [[yyy (zelda10010)|yyy]], voiced by [[Tomita Miyu]].

She is the second natural UR ship in the game. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], wears a black [[bodystocking]] with a futuristic style over[[coat]] on her shoulders, [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], white [[miniskirt]], bluish-chrome [[high heels]], and a headpiece with her hull number (BB-62) inscribed on it. She has an upbeat and flashy personality, rarely seen without a smile on her face.

Her [[rigging]] consists of her three 406 mm triple Mk7 mounts and four of her ten historical 127 mm twin mounts in an equally-futuristic rig with an electrically-charged glowing ring to her back.

She was launched on December 7th 1942, exactly one year after the Pearl Harbor attack. She took part in numerous actions from World War II to Vietnam and earned 19 battle stars in her long service before being decommissioned for the last time on February 8th 1991. Her historic counterpart is currently a museum ship located in Camden, New Jersey.

h4. Skins

title: blade_to_throat
body:
When a sharp object (usually a [[knife]] or a [[sword]]) is pointed to another's throat. Usually as a [[threat]] to force the victim to comply, lest their [[slit throat|throat be cut]].

h4. See also
* [[At knifepoint]]
* [[At gunpoint]]

body:

title: kalpas_(honkai_impact)
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] character. 

One of the [[Thirteen Flame-Chasers (honkai impact)|]], codenamed [b]Decimation[/b]. He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[muscular male|muscular build]], and wears a black [[mask]] covering his face. 

His default outfit consists of a [[black shirt]], [[single glove|single]] [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves|elbow glove]] on his left hand, [[black belt]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

h4. Skins

* !post #5364593: Default

* [[Mydei (honkai: star rail)|]] - his [i][[Honkai: Star Rail]][/i] counterpart.

title: nissan_180sx
body:
A [[car]] produced by [[Nissan]] from 1988 to 1998.

Sold in several import markets as the fourth generation of the 200SX. It is especially popular in [[drifting|drift]] communities, which has created a "drift tax" that has inflated the price of parts and the cars themselves due to many examples being destroyed or heavily damaged through drifting. 

This and the [[Nissan Silvia]] were sold as the [b]240SX[/b] in North America.

h4. See Also
* [[Nissan Sileighty]] - a popular customization of the 180SX that replaces the front end with that of a [[Nissan Silvia]].

body: The idiom "I'm all ears", typically signaling that the speaker is ready to listen, taken [[too literal|too literally]] with either [[very long ears|oversized ears]] or having the character being entirely made out of ears

title: big_eared_miyabi_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] in the [[Zenless Zone Zero]] community revolving around depicting [[Hoshimi Miyabi]] with [[very long ears]].

Gained popularity from [[nepnepping]]'s drawings of Miyabi when a fan said "I think the ears are too small," prompting edits where her ears are made [[too long|even larger]]. Also often combined with "[[I'm all ears (meme)|]]" meme.

title: firefly_(jepella_rebellion)_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] worn by [[Firefly (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] during the events of the Jepella Rebellion.

Unlike her fellow Stellaron Hunters, her outfit isn't shown during "Myriad Celestia Trailer: The Jepella Rebellion — Scene 47":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D9yIlGpgCus], due to not appearing as herself at any point during the video (she instead appears as [[SAM (honkai: star rail)|]]); her outfit during the rebellion is seen during a flashback CG during the Penacony story arc.

While her skirt is canonically a long black skirt, some fan artists depict it as a [[pencil skirt]] under the assumption that she is the female figure standing above [[Kafka (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] in her splash art (post #7689897). 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8035938
other_names: ホタル(ヤペラー反逆事件衣装)

title: katsuragi_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Katsuragi[/i], the third of the [i]Unryuu[/i]-class.
Character design by [[Izuru (Timbermetal)|]], voiced by [[Toda Megumi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with prominent [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of [[shide]] that she uses to tie the twintails, an unorthodox [[blue dress]], white [[thighhighs]], black [[platform footwear]], [[see-through cape|see-through]] [[cape]], [[shimenawa]] belt, and an unorthodox see-through [[hakama]].

She uses a rig that is unorthodox of her standing as an aircraft carrier. Her rig prominently displays 12.7 cm DP twin mounts and 25 mm anti-air guns, reflective of the fact that she never fulfilled her intended carrier role. The rig does have two white banners, one on each side, that serve as her [[flight deck]]. As seen in the reference sheet, the red-colored marks are actually her [i]real-life camouflage pattern[/i].

In real life, she was completed late into the war and never received her air group, instead spending her career in Kure as an AA platform alongside her sister ship Amagi (of the Unryuu-class, not the battlecruiser [[Amagi (Azur Lane)|]]). Ultimately, she survived the war and served as a repatriation ship (the largest surviving ship Japan could field in that role) before being sold for scrap in 1946.


h4. Appearance

title: hai_chi_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Imperial Chinese Navy protected cruiser [i]Hai Chi[/i] in [[Azur Lane]].

Historically, she and her sister ship [[Hai Tien (Azur Lane)|]] were the largest ships China had for several decades (compare their 4,300 tons while [[Ning Hai (Azur Lane)|]] had a displacement of 2,500 tons). She was originally commissioned in 1899 and served until 1937 when she was scuttled to slow down the Japanese advance down the Yangtze towards Wuhan.

In Azur Lane, she and her sister Hai Tien are reclassed as light cruisers to conform to existing gameplay ship types.

h4. Appearance

title: gquuuuuux
body:
Namesake [[mobile suit]] of [[gundam_gquuuuuux|Mobile Suit Gundam GQuuuuuuX]].  Pronounced "gee-KWUCKS", after the computer science metasyntactic variable [i]quux[/i]. 

It is also notable for being the first lead Gundam to be equipped with an [[axe]], which is usually a signature weapon of antagonist mass production type mobile suits, such as the [[Zaku II]]'s [[heat hawk]].

title: haman_karn
body:
Antagonist female character from [i][[Zeta Gundam]][/i] and [i][[Gundam ZZ]][/i]. An intelligent, calculating, cold, cruel and evil beautiful woman, she is the regent to [[Mineva Lao Zabi]] and de facto leader of [[Neo Zeon]]. Haman pilots the [[mobile suit]]s [[Gaza-C]] and the [[Qubeley]]. [spoilers]A powerful Newtype, Haman Karn dies during a pivotal [[space]] [[battle]] duel against [[Judau Ashta]] in his [[ZZ Gundam]] at the end of Gundam ZZ.[/spoilers]

She is also featured heavily in [[Char's Deleted Affair]] as a teenager, and an [[office lady]] AU version of her is the protagonist of [[Arasa OL Haman-sama]].

Haman's peculiar hairstyle was based on "this photo":https://www.pinterest.com/pin/37788084359430218/.

title: kirishima_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Kirishima[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[green-framed_eyewear|green-framed]] [[glasses]], and [[grey eyes]]. In the anime, the lenses of her glasses have a [[heads-up display]] that shows various information. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko|modified miko]] uniform with differently colored [[skirt|skirts]] (hers is [[black skirt|black]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]].

Sometimes seen holding a [[microphone]] due to her doing a mic check in her intro as well as in her hourlies.

The comic was adapted into a series of web shorts produced by Tencent Penguin Pictures in 2020.

title: serval_landau
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Terakawa Aimi]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient end]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is a custom Silvermane Guard attire of an [[asymmetrical jacket|asymmetrical]] [[white jacket]] worn to her right, [[midriff]] [[black shirt]], [[choker]], black [[bridal gauntlets|bridal gauntlet]] on her left arm, [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She uses a modified [[electric guitar]] as her main weapon.

She is the eldest daughter of the Landau family and a mechanic who runs the Neverwinter Workshop, a rock 'n' roll performance workshop in Belobog as a hobby. Older sister to [[Gepard Landau|Gepard]] and [[Lynx Landau|Lynx]]. 

h4. Costumes

* !post #7689976: Splash art
* !post #7732708: Make the World Clamor (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
The free and rebellious eldest daughter of the Landau family. Once a close friend of Cocolia's, she is now a mechanic purely because she likes this job.

In the Everwinter-stricken Belobog, she opened a workshop called "Neverstop" that puts business on hold from time to time for outdoor rock 'n' roll performances.

And should anyone ask her about the workshop's profits... "This is just a hobby, dear. I'm not short on money."
[/expand]

h4. External links


* "Honkai: Star Rail HoyoWiki - Serval":[https://wiki.hoyolab.com/pc/hsr/entry/16]
other_names: セーバル・ランドゥー
セーバル(スターレイル)

title: jean_bart_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s representation of the French battleship [i]Jean Bart[/i].  Character design by [[Ask (askzy)]], voiced by [[Inoue Marina]].

She is the leader of Vichya Dominion (the game's version of the Vichy French regime), having [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]], and [[brown hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]].

As her namesake is a historical French [[pirate|privateer]], her design is piratical in theme. Her outfit consists of a [[black jacket]] with gold fringes and [[epaulettes]], [[black dress]], red [[corset]], [[black shorts]], black [[knee boots|knee boot]] to her left and a regular boot to her right, single [[striped legwear|striped]] [[thighhighs|thighhigh]], and a single [[red gloves|red glove]].

Her [[rigging]] is somewhat similar to her sister [[Richelieu (azur lane)|]], albeit her gun coverings are painted black, while she uses 100 mm twin mounts instead of 152 mm triple mounts as a secondary armament. While she also has a bridge structure holding the two sides together, it lacks the [[mast]] and [[radar]]s of her sister for historical reasons. She also carries a large [[French flag]] with the Vichy battle-ax in the middle.



h4. Skins

* !post #3632576: [[jean bart (uninhibited bloodstone) (azur lane)|Uninhibited Bloodstone]]

title: aburamushi_eve_(gunarmdyne)
body: Original {{Touhou}} character created by @GunarmDyne. Eve is a hawk tengu created solely to be {{Shameimaru Aya}}'s fierce rival and her name both means and is a reference to {{Parasite Eve}}. She is very predatory in snatching scoops where she can, but also remains very professional when interviewing people. Too much, in fact, as she has no people skills otherwise.

title: gepard_landau
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Furukawa Makoto]] in Japanese.

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. His default outfit is a custom Silvermane Guard [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] worn under a [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[white jacket]] with crystal [[armor]] pieces, single [[white gloves|white glove]] on his left hand, [[single gauntlet]] on his right hand, [[white pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

He is the captain of the Silvermane Guards who belongs to the noble Landau family in Belobog, and is responsible for the city's defenses and maintains peace. Younger brother to [[Serval Landau|Serval]] and big brother to [[Lynx Landau|Lynx]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7689981: Splash art
* !post #8768065: Moment of Victory (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
An upright and noble captain of the Silvermane Guards who bears the name of the age-old Landau family.

In the blizzard-battered city of Belobog, defense is much more challenging than attack. Gepard and the Silvermane Guards he leads serve as the unbreakable iron defense of the Union in this hostile world.

Sometimes he is ridiculed by his sister and aide for his ever-scrupulous manner, but no one can deny that the people of Belobog have been able to maintain peace and comfort even with eternal winter on its doorstep...

With Gepard's protection, the city can carry on with its ordinary daily routine.
[/expand]


h4. External links

* "Honkai: Star Rail HoyoWiki - Gepard":[https://wiki.hoyolab.com/pc/hsr/entry/17]

title: elica_margatroid_(gunarmdyne)
body: Original {{Touhou}} character created by @GunarmDyne and is [[Alice Margatroid]]'s little sister. She is a kind-hearted woman who can read the hearts of others and detect when they are telling lies, which also makes her incapable of telling lies herself. Very modest by nature, she becomes incredibly flustered when wearing outfits that showcase even a small amount of skin.

title: yazawa_nico
body:
Character in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. A member of μ's and president of the Idol Research Club.

Yazawa Nico is a student at Otonokizaka High School. She has [[red eyes]] and [[black hair]] worn in [[twintails]] and, despite being a third-year, a very childish figure. She is a member of the μ's sub-unit BiBi, alongside [[Ayase Eli]] and [[Nishikino Maki]]. Her catch phrase is "[[Nico Nico nii]]".

Voiced by [[Tokui Sora]] (JPN), [[Erica Mendez]] (ENG).

title: okusawa_misaki
body:
The composer and [[dj]] of [[Hello Happy World!]] in [[BanG Dream!]]. She performs as [[michelle_(bang_dream!)|Michelle]], wearing a pink teddy bear costume.

Misaki has [[medium_hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] and blue-[[grey eyes]]. Offstage, she's often depicted wearing a [[grey hoodie]] printed with [[clothes writing]], with a [[cropped_jacket|cropped]] [[blue jacket]] over it, [[black shorts]], a [[hairclip]], and a black and grey [[baseball cap]] with a [[character_hair_ornament|Michelle-themed hair ornament]].

Misaki's sarcastic, down-to-earth personality often puts her at odds with the other members of her band, with the exception of [[Matsubara Kanon]], who she finds more sensible.

Her birthday is October 1st. Her seiyuu is [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

title: yanfei_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character. A half-human, half-iluminated beast who works as a well-known legal adviser active in Liyue Harbor. 

Yanfei never signed a contract with Rex Lapis even being half-Adeptus since she was born during peacetime.

Her name is pronounced [b]Enhi[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Yanfei has [[orange hair]] and eyes that are either [[green eyes|green]] or [[aqua eyes|aqua]]. She wears a [[red hat]] called a [[xiezhi guan]]. Her outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] top that is [[crop top|cropped]] to show her [[midriff]], with [[detached sleeves]]. She wears a [[red skirt]] over [[black shorts]] on her lower half, along with [[red footwear|red]] [[high heel boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4552046: Official Artwork

title: seamed_legwear
body:
Any sort of stockings, [[pantyhose]], [[thighhighs]], [[bodysuit]], or other [[tag group:legwear|legwear]] featuring a vertical seam ([i]not[/i] [[vertical-striped legwear|vertical stripes]]) running up the legs.

This tag encompasses all types of seamed legwear, including [[back-seamed legwear|back-seamed]], [[front-seamed legwear|front-seamed]], and [[side-seamed legwear|side-seamed]]. [b]Please use one of these more specific tags when tagging[/b], not just [[seamed legwear]].

title: hanatsuka_aika
body:
One of the main characters of {{soi_kano_~gyutto_dakishimete~|Soi Kano ~Gyutto Dakishimete~}}.

Kouhei and Riku's cousin. She chose to attend the same school as Kouhei and Riku, in addition to that she lives together with the siblings. She and Riku are much like sisters. She has a hidden hobby that is painting (actually she's an otaku). In class, she's a a honor student so she's unable to reveal to anyone that she's an otaku.

She has {{pink_hair|pink}} {{long_hair|long}} hair, {{purple_eyes|purple eyes}}, a slim body with {{big_breasts|big breasts}}.

!post #3047631: Full body

title: tb_(azur_lane)
body:
An [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] supporting character, termed the "Auxiliary Augmented Identification Interface, Class Navigator, Codename **TB**" 
Voiced by Kasuga Nozomi. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with a [[two-tone hair|single]] [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[streaked hair|streak]], [[black nails]], and is [[barefoot]]. Her outfit is a plain [[white dress]] with multiple black [[cable]]s from her back. 

A special Augmented Auxiliary System sent by Headquarters, to help Commanders on a Special Operation. It connects to a 'Main Engine' and provides any support needed for the upcoming Operation. Her true identity, however, is shrouded in mystery.

title: kirakishou
body:
[i]Snow Crystal[/i]

The seventh and final [[Rozen Maiden]] doll. She is both emotionally and physically unstable, being the only doll not given a body. She fights using [[white rose]] [[vines]]. She does not have a master, instead choosing to kidnap the others' masters.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] with [[two side up]] held with [[hair flower|roses]] and [[sidelocks]] and [[yellow eyes]] with a [[white rose]] [[flower over eye|over one eye]]. Her outfit is similar to [[Barasuishou]]'s [[lolita fashion]], consisting of a [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[white shirt]] with [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[juliet sleeves]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[white skirt]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[thigh boots]].

title: gadabout_(dq3)
body:
One of the character classes in [[Dragon Quest III]]. The female version has [[blonde hair]] and wears a [[playboy bunny]] costume, while the male version is dressed as a [[clown]].

The Japanese name is 遊び人 (Asobinin), in the NES localisation the class was called goof-off. The Gadabout is the only class that can become a [[sage (dq3)|Sage]] without needing to use a special item.

title: sphinx
body:
In [[Ancient Egyptian]] culture, sphinx is a creature that has the body of a lion, while the head could be a human, ram, or bird. They are most commonly assigned to protect the sacred places.

In [[Greek mythology]], sphinx is an individual monster with human female torso with a lion body. The sphinx in Greek mythology is usually seen preying on the adventurer by asking the riddles to decide their fate.

h4. See also

* [[Sphinx of Giza]]
* [[centaur]]
* [[chimera]]
* [[lion girl]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: side_slit
body:
When a dress or skirt has a cutout slit. Either single or double and in some cases, accidental through fighting.

Most [[china_dress|China dresses]] come with a side slit.

If a dress or skirt has high slits on both sides, it may form a [[pelvic curtain]].
If the slit starts at the top of the skirt and doesn't go all the way down to the bottom, use [[hip vent]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[front slit]]
* [[back slit]]
* [[cross-laced slit]]

title: glacial_master_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male_mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|male Mage]]. Also known as the Hell Freezer or Eternal.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/2/2b/GlacialMasterPortrait.jpg] has his black hair turning white, featuring black clothing with red decorations and a red sash.

As an "Eternal":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/2/2a/Eternal1.png], his skin is more pale, his hair is almost waist-length, and his clothing has more blue colors and snowflake decorations, appropriate for his powers.

title: knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/1/16/KnightPortrait.png] is a young woman with blue eyes, shoulder-length pink hair, worn loose (save for an [[ahoge]]), and a [[large_breasts|noticeable bust]]. She wears a white and gold jacket split into two tails at its end, a red skirt, and knee-high black boots.

Subclasses:
* [[elven_knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Elven Knight]] (Peacemaker, Gaia)
* [[chaos_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Chaos]] (Demon Queen, Demon God)
* [[lightbringer (dungeon and fighter)|Lightbringer]] (Archangel, Savior)
* [[dragon_knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Dragon Knight]] (Braveheart, Dreadnought)

title: lightbringer_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Knight]]. Also known as the Archangel or Savior.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/6/6b/Female_Paladin_Art.png] has her hair styled into a sidetail, with her outfit remaining mostly the same as her base class save for golden gauntlets, greaves and pauldrons, as well as black thighhighs.

As a "Savior":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/f/fb/SaviorPortrait.jpg], she wears additional armor; namely, a winged tiara and breastplate. Her hair is also now worn loose, and a pair of angel wings can be seen on her back. In the background is an avatar of "Carloso":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/b6/Carloso.jpg], the god the Knights serve.

title: okobo
body:
Japanese [[platform footwear|platform]] [[sandals]] that were traditionally worn by [[geisha]] during their apprenticeship. The most notable type in fanart are the black-lacquered kind with red straps. 

Technically, the black-lacquered finish is only worn mainly during summer, and the color of the straps used changes depending upon how far along the apprentice geisha is in her training.

Not to be confused with [[geta]], which have two square "teeth" on the sole instead of being made as a solid block, or [[zouri]], which are flat like flip flops.

h4. Examples

* !post #8439965

h4. See also

* [[geta]]
* [[zouri]]
* [[wedge heels]]
* [[Tag group:Attire]]

h4. External links

title: wien_margarete
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Superstar!!]]. Initially introduced as a rival of [i]Liella![/i] in their second attempt at the Love Live! competition before joining them in the next school year. [spoiler]But not before attempting to create [[tomakanote (love live!)|her own group]] to oppose them.[/spoiler]

She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[purple hair]] with [[side braids]] on both sides and [[blunt bangs]].

In the second season, she typically wears a uniform very similar to the [[Mizukawa school uniform]], only with a [[black necktie]], a [[red sweater vest]], and no emblem. In the third season, she wears the standard [[Yuigaoka school uniform]].

Voiced by [[Yuina (voice actor)|]].
other_names: ウィーン・マルガレーテ

title: juujou_hiyori
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[Heijou Institute School Uniform|Heijou Institute School]]. Has a cool and stoic personality, but also a strong duty of justice. Very like [[mint chocolate]] to the point that she will be furious if someone insult that food. Voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]]/[[brown hair]] styled in [[hime cut]] and a [[red eyes]]. Her katana is "Kogarasumaru":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kogarasu_Maru] and she use Kashima Shinto-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: idi_nahui
body:
An [[ukrainian text|Ukrainian]] (іди нахуй) and [[russian text|Russian]] (иди нахуй) vulgar expletive, usually translated as "go fuck yourself" or simply "fuck off". Can be rendered in various ways using the Latin alphabet, with the most common being 'idi nahui' (with 'idi nahuj' close behind).

Ukrainian "іді нахуй" is a part of transliteration of Russian "Русский военный корабль, иди нахуй" ("[[russo-ukrainian war|Russian warship, go fuck yourself]]"). This quote was used on a big amount of Ukrainian posters. One of those, with yellow text on blue background with big stylized "іді", later became a [[meme]] after being cropped to just "іді нахуй".

* !asset #23051790: Original poster
* !asset #23051811: Meme

title: kitora_mirja
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi]] from [[ayanokouji martial arts school uniform|Ayanokouji Martial Arts School]]. A half Japanese-Scandinavian girl that serve as commander of her team. Strict as a leader, but deep down she's a hardliner Katana [[otaku]]. Voiced by [[Numakura Manami]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] styled in [[half up braid]], [[orange eyes|orange]]/[[brown eyes]] and wear a [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[glasses]]. Her katana is Jikkyuu Mitsutada and she use Maniwa Nen-ryu as her fighting style.

title: setouchi_chie
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi]] from [[osafune girls academy school uniform|Osafune Girl's Academy]]. [[Asakura Mihono|Mihono's]] childhood friend and older sister figure to her team. Voiced by [[Ishihara Kaori]]. 

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] styled in [[wolf cut]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]]. Her katana is Sohayanotsurugi and she use Jikishinkage-ryuu as her fighting style.

title: kohagura_ellen
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[osafune girls academy school uniform|Osafune Girl's Academy]]. A Japanese-American girl that like to be a moodmaker and always act friendly towards others, even giving them make up nicknames by her. Voiced by [[Suzuki Eri (voice actor)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[black hairband|hairband]], [[blue eyes]], and [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical stockings]]. Her katana is Echizen Yasutsugu and she use Taisha-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: yanase_mai
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[minoseki gakuin uniform|Minoseki Gakuin]]. Possesses an older-sister like tendency to take care of others. She likes to makes [[cookie|cookies]]. Voiced by [[Waki Azumi]]. 

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]] [[folded ponytail]] hair and a [[green eyes]]. Her katana is Magoroku Kanemoto and she use Hokushin Itto-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: etou_kanami
body:
Main character and protagonist in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[Minoseki Gakuin uniform|Minoseki Gakuin]]. A cheerful and positive girl, she loves sword matches and seeing how opponents devise tactics when fight against her. Voiced by [[Hondo Kaede]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[one side up]] tied by a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] and a [[brown eyes]]. Her katana is Chidori (the one that wielded by Tachibana Dōsetsu) and she use Yagyu Shinkage-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: kazama_souta
body:
Main/supportive character of [[Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi]], the deadpan snarker of the story. 

Initially was the "nameless male co-worker in the office other than Senpai" to crowd up the place, but he got his own character development later in the series. Often looks like he's lacking sleep sometimes - he does. Kazama is a man who knows "when to fold 'em" - butt in or leave at [i]just[/i] the right moment. Occasionally snarky just by presence alone. His seemingly expressionless face adds silliness in certain situations.
Has a hobby of making [[origami]] and is very skilled at it.

Is very in-sync with Sakurai to the point they're often seen as couple. Traits shared with her: whipping out his phone for making photos (usually Futaba's antics), messing with phone's photo apps. 

[spoiler]He essentially sees Sakurai as love interest and is her childhood friend.[/spoiler]

[i]Appearance:[/i] Average height, thin man. [[jitome|Flat half-open eyes]], black messy hair, constricted pupils. Usually expressionless.

Associated color: inconsistent "Shades of Azure":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shades_of_azure throughout series. Currently it's "True Blue.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shades_of_azure#True_blue

title: hololive
body:
Hololive (stylized as "hololive") is an all-female [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] group managed by Hololive Production, which itself is owned and operated by Cover Corp.

As of September 2023, the hololive group consists of 4 major branches: the original Japanese-speaking branch (unofficially referred to as Hololive Japan), the other Japanese-speaking branch [[hololive DEV_IS]], [[hololive Indonesia]], and [[hololive English]] (There was also the now-disbanded [[hololive China]]). Each branch is further divided into multiple generations, where each generation is a batch of VTubers who debuted at the same time. Hololive Production also manages the all-male counterpart group [[Holostars]].

In February 2021, Cover announced [[hololive Alternative]], a multimedia project including several manga and music videos that aims to tell in-universe stories using the hololive VTubers' character backstories. Later, in August 2021, Cover announced [[hololive Error]], a horror-themed spin-off project. A year later, in June 2022, Cover announced [[Holoearth]], a game featuring various hololive members. In March 2023, Cover announced [[Blue Journey (hololive)|]], a new musical project.

h4. List of Members

h5. hololive (original branch, [i]a.k.a.[/i] hololive Japan)

h6. hololive "[[0th Generation (hololive)|]]"

A term for the members not under a specific grouping. Some of these members debuted as independents and were initially brought into other now-defunct branches of the company before joining Hololive proper.

* [[Tokino Sora]] (debuted September 2017)
* [[Roboco-san]] (debuted March 2018)
* [[Hoshimachi Suisei]] (debuted as indie in March 2018, joined the company in May 2019, joined Hololive in December 2019)
* [[Sakura Miko]] (debuted August 2018, joined Hololive in December 2018)
* [[AZKi (hololive)|]] (debuted November 2018, joined Hololive in April 2022)

title: ligne_claire
body:
[b]Ligne claire[/b] (French for "clear line") is an art style characterized by strong black [[outline|outlines]], [[flat color|flat colors]], and detailed backgrounds with little contrast between the subject and the background.

The style was popularized by Hergé, the creator of [[Tintin]]. In anime related art, the style was popularized by [[Cogecha]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6265228
* !post #3096022
* !post #1497869

* "Wikipedia: Ligne claire":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ligne_claire

Unnamed or [[faceless]] characters don't count.

title: han_solo
body:
One of the main characters from [[Star Wars]]. He was played by actor [[Harrison Ford]] in the "Skywalker Saga" movies (specifically the original and sequel trilogies) and by "Alden Ehrenreich":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alden_Ehrenreich in his titular spin-off movie [[Solo: A Star Wars Story]].

[b]Han Solo[/b] is a galactic smuggler and former [[tie pilot|Imperial pilot]]. His [[spacecraft]] of choice is the [[Millennium Falcon]], which he won from [[Lando Calrissian]] in a high-stakes card game. [[Chewbacca]] is Solo's best friend and partner in crime.

He and Chewbacca were hired by [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Luke Skywalker]] on [[Tatooine]] to transport them to the planet Alderaan, but those plans soon went awry. Initially only aiding the [[Rebel Alliance (Star Wars)|Rebellion]] to pay off his debt to the crime lord [[Jabba the Hutt|Jabba]], Han shelved much of his cynicism, proved his heroism and became a Rebel leader.

[b]Major spoilers from [[star wars: the force awakens|Episode VII]] of Star Wars below.[/b]

[spoiler]After the defeat of the [[Galactic Empire (star wars)|]] following Episode VI, [[Star Wars: Return of the Jedi|Return of The Jedi]], he became the husband of [[princess leia|Leia]] and the father of [[Ben Solo]] a.k.a. [[Kylo Ren]]. In Episode VII, he confronts his son to try and turn him away from the Dark Side, but is killed by him.[/spoiler]

title: chen_qianyu_(arknights)
body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Chen Qianyu is a specialist operator of Endfield Industries.

She began martial arts training at a young age and later joined the Yinglung Special Task Force. Her experiences endowed her with outstanding combat capabilities and a mental fortitude rarely seen in people her age.

No matter the situation or circumstances, this optimistic girl will always stay true to herself and never give up in the face of adversity.
[/quote]

body:
The logo for Trinity General School in [[Blue Archive]].

Often appearing on the clothing of students, typically on their [[shirt]], on their [[equipment]], and [[lanyard]]s. Its design incorporates a combination of the [[cross]], 3 circles and a reverse triangle. Representing its academy, its factions and the Trinity in Christian Theology that it is based off.

Not to be confused with [[skirt]]. A dress is a single piece of clothing, while a [[skirt]] is a separate piece of clothing. Dresses should not be tagged with [[skirt]].

title: kyuubi
body:
A [[fox]] (or [[fox girl]]) with [[multiple tails|nine tails]].

This is stated in Japanese lore to be the pinnacle of age and power for a [[kitsune]], and takes at least 800 years to attain, 100 years for each extra tail the kitsune grows as their power and age increases. Kyuubi are supposedly near-godlike in power. The Korean equivalent is called a [i]gumiho/kumiho[/i], while the Chinese equivalent is called a [i]huli jing[/i] (although, traditionally, kumiho are much more likely to be murderous and evil than playful and nice, and may not always have nine tails despite the hanja/hanji being that for "nine-tailed fox").

h4. Examples

title: wilhuff_tarkin
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] franchise and the main antagonist of the first film, [[Star Wars: A New Hope|A New Hope]].

[b]Wilhuff Tarkin[/b], also known as [b]Grand Moff Tarkin[/b], was a thin, middle-aged Human male who was one of the most powerful officers in the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]], a Grand Moff who shaped Imperial doctrine and was the driving force behind the creation of its key embodiment, the gargantuan [[planet]]-destroying superweapon, the [[Death Star]].
other_names: グランド・モフ・ウィルハフ・ターキン
グランド・モフ・ターキン
ウィルハフ・ターキン

title: star_wars:_a_new_hope
body:
[b]Star Wars[/b] (retroactively retitled [b]Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope[/b]) is a 1977 American epic space opera [[science fiction]] film written and directed by [[George Lucas]], produced by Lucasfilm and distributed by [[20th century studios]].

The cast includes [[Mark Hamill]], [[Harrison Ford]], [[Carrie Fisher]], Peter Cushing, Alec Guinness, Anthony Daniels, Kenny Baker, Peter Mayhew, David Prowse, and [[James Earl Jones]].

Set a long time ago in a far away galaxy that is ruled by the tyrannical [[Galactic Empire (Star Wars)|]], the story focuses on a group of freedom fighters known as the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]], who aim to destroy the Empire's newest weapon, the [[Death Star]]. When Rebel leader [[Princess Leia|Princess Leia]] is apprehended by the Empire, [[Luke Skywalker]] acquires stolen architectural plans of the Death Star and sets out to rescue her while learning the ways of a metaphysical power known as "the Force" from [[Jedi]] Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]].

Star Wars was followed by [[The Star Wars Holiday Special]] in 1978, [[Star Wars: The Empire strikes back|The Empire Strikes Back]] in 1980 and [[Star Wars: return of The Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] in 1983, which concludes the original film trilogy.
other_names: スター・ウォーズエピソード4

title: amber_sugar
body: Kohakutou or amber sugar / amber candy is a Japanese confection made from agar, sugar, and flavoring/coloring. The result is a hard, crystal-like rock candy with a jelly interior.

title: tsuburaya_mitsuhiko
body: A character from [[Meitantei Conan]]. One of [[Edogawa Conan]]'s classmates and a member of the Detective Boys, providing intelligent insight for solving cases. He develops a crush for both [[Yoshida Ayumi]] and [[Haibara Ai]]. Voiced by [[Ootani Ikue]].

title: kylo_ren
body:
Character introduced in the [[Star Wars]] sequel trilogy.

[b]Kylo Ren[/b] is the personal apprentice of Supreme Leader [[Snoke]] and the leader of the Knights of Ren, a group of [[darksider (star wars)|Dark Side users]] who are inspired by (but distinct from) the original [[Sith]] cult. 

Kylo is one of the commanders of the [[First Order]], and shows no hesitancy in using brute force to achieve his goals. He wields a red [[crossguard lightsaber]] and his apprearance is reminiscent of [[Darth Vader]]'s, wearing a face-obscuring helmet and long black clothing.

He is introduced in [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]], and is played by American actor "Adam Driver":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam_Driver.

h4. See also

[spoiler]* [[Ben Solo]][/spoiler]

title: lightsaber
body:
[quote][i]“This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or random as a blaster; an elegant weapon for a more civilized age...”[/i] ― [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]][/quote]

An [[energy sword]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] universe, most often wielded by the honorable [[Jedi]] knights and their mortal enemies, the evil [[Sith]]. The sword's color typically reflects the user's affiliation, with the Jedi using green or blue, the Sith and other [[darksider (star wars)|Dark Side adherents]] using red, and miscellaneous other colors used by both factions.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

title: rock_howard
body:
Biological son of [[Geese Howard]], adopted son of [[Terry Bogard]], Rock Howard is the protagonist of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]] and [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], while also making a number of appearances in [[The King of Fighters]]. Following Geese's death after falling from his tower, Terry took a young Rock under his wing as the boy's guardian. Rock took moves from both of his fathers, learning moves from Terry and inheriting some of Geese's trademark techniques. He has business with [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]], the new big boss of South Town's underworld and the man who not only claims to be Rock's uncle, but also that the late Marie Heinlein - Rock's mother and Kain's sister - is alive.

Fans often pair him with [[Type-Moon]]'s [[Arima Miyako]] in [[M.U.G.E.N]] and other fan works since they are both adoptees of their respective families (Rock being the Bogards, Miyako being the Tohno).

title: gay_ellis
body:
A character from the [[UFO (1970 tv series)|]] TV series. Played by British actress "Gabrielle Drake":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabrielle_Drake.

[b]Lieutenant Gay Ellis[/b] is a [[SHADO (ufo)|]] tactical officer with [[purple hair]] and a [[bob cut]]. She operates as SHADO's Moonbase Commander during the series.

title: edward_striker
body:
A character from the [[UFO (1970 tv series)|]] science fiction TV series from the early 70s. He was played by British actor "Ed Bishop":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_Bishop.

[b]Commander Edward Straker[/b] is the head of [[SHADO (ufo)|]] Headquarters, located below a fake film studio.

title: ufo_(1970_tv_series)
body:
[b]UFO[/b] is a 1970 [[United Kingdom|British]] [[science fiction]] TV series created by Gerry Anderson and Sylvia Anderson.

The series deals with an [[alien]] invasion of Earth during the near future, and the efforts of a top secret international organization called [[SHADO (ufo)|]] to stop it.

title: ben_solo
body:
[b]Ben Solo[/b] is a character from the new sequel trilogy of [[Star Wars]] films. 

[spoiler]He is the son of [[Han Solo]] and [[Princess Leia]]. Ben trained to become a [[Jedi]] under his uncle [[Luke Skywalker]]'s tutelage. 

He was turned to the Dark Side of the Force by the evil Supreme Leader Snoke and became [[Kylo Ren]]. Ben killed other aspiring Jedi students and destroyed Luke's new Jedi Academy. After this Luke went into a self-imposed exile out of pity for his loss.[/spoiler]

Ben first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015.

title: metro-goldwyn-mayer
body:
Iconic American film studio founded in 1924 by the merger of three separate studios (Metro Pictures, Goldwyn Pictures Corporation, and Louis B. Mayer Pictures) under one umbrella.  Also known by the initials "MGM."

The studio's famous and often-parodied logo is a roaring [[lion]] in a circle formed by strips of film, with the [[Latin text|Latin legend]] [i]Ars Gratia Artis[/i] ("Art for Art's Sake," MGM's motto) on top and a stylized [[comedy and tragedy masks|theatre mask]] below.  

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

title: sith
body:
[i]Peace is a lie. There is only Passion.
Through Passion I gain Strength.
Through Strength I gain Power.
Through Power I gain Victory.
Through Victory my chains are Broken.
The Force shall free me.[/i] - The Code of the Sith.

A fictional [[darksider_(star_wars)|darksider]] group from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

An order of merciless, treacherous, power-hungry warriors and conquerors, the [b]Sith[/b] despise weaker lifeforms and seek only total control of the galaxy and the Force with the complete destruction of their adversaries, most notably the [[Jedi]].

Their main weapon is the [[lightsaber]], which usually has a [[red lightsaber|red colored laser blade]].

* [[Darth Maul]]
* [[Count Dooku]]

title: shado_(ufo)
body:
A fictional top-secret human organization from the [[ufo (1970 tv series)|UFO]] TV series from the early 1970s.

[b]S.H.A.D.O.[/b] ([b]S[/b]upreme [b]H[/b]eadquarters, [b]A[/b]lien [b]D[/b]efense [b]O[/b]rganization) is a hi-tech secret armed group created to defend the Earth from an [[alien]] invasion.

SHADO has a variety of advanced hardware and vehicles at its disposal to implement a layered defense of planet Earth. Early warnings of alien attack would come from SID, the Space Intruder Detector, a computerized tracking [[satellite]] that constantly scans for [[UFO]] incursions. 

The forward line of defense is Moonbase from which three [[Lunar Interceptor]] [[spacecraft]], carrying nuclear missiles, are launched. 

The second line of defense includes [[Skydiver]], a submarine mated with the submersible, undersea-launched [[Sky One]] interceptor aircraft, which attacks UFOs in Earth's atmosphere. 

The last line of defense are ground units including the heavy armed and armored, IFV-like [[SHADO Mobile]]s, fitted with caterpillar tracks.

Lt. [[Gay Ellis]] is a notable member of the group.

title: swire_(arknights)

A Senior Superintendent of the Lungmen Guard Department. She now acts as a special attaché at Rhodes Island, providing on-site tactical command. Her choice of weapon is a spiked [[ball and chain (weapon)|]].

Her motif is based on tigers.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Tokui Sora]] (Japanese), Ying Xie (Mandarine), Dong Dong (Cantonese), Emma Ballantine (English), and Kim Yui (Korean). Her art designer is [[xiayehongming]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3770298: Default
* !post #3770299: Elite II

Her swimsuit outfit, which she wears in the [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i] side story, should not be confused with her alternate form [[swire_the_elegant_wit_(arknights)|Swire the Elegant Wit]].
* The former has a white [[sun hat]], a [[pearl necklace]], a [[tied jacket|tied]] [[see-through jacket]], a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on her right hand. Her hair is loose, her shoes have an [[o-ring]] and her [[black one-piece swimsuit]] is tied with two [[strap]]s on the front.
* The latter is overall much more detailed: her sun hat is now black, the necklace is [[gold necklace|golden]], the glove is on her left hand, her nails are painted and her hair is tied in a [[single braid]]. The outfit itself is more of jacket with [[black shorts]], a [[white vest]] and a [[black shawl]].

title: lunasia_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character in [[Girls' Frontline]].

[spoiler]Though her precise origins were unknown at first, clones of hers with altered memories would be sent on a quest for vengeance against G&K, resulting in their deaths. Upon recovering one of the bodies and discovering the similarity her brain appeared to have to a T-Doll's Neural Cloud, [[Persica (girls' frontline)|]] went ahead and scanned the corpse's brain, utilizing the data to create a Neural Cloud model. She would lend a copy to former colleague [[Lycoris (girls' frontline)|]], who'd go on to create [[Elisa (girls' frontline)|]] with it, while Persica would use the model to create the [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], using varying amounts of the scans for each member, [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]] embodying the most, and [[RO635 (girls' frontline)|]] the least, with her instead using it as a basis for the next gen of dolls, making her more stable and duplicable.

As a result of the amount of scan data that was used for her, M4A1 would be recognized by Elisa and [[Dandelion (girls' frontline)|her OGAS]] as "Lunasia."[/spoiler]
[spoiler]The [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s bare a resemblance to not just M4A1, but Lunasia as well, and it would be revealed that not only is the leader of [[Paradeus]] [[William (reverse collapse)|]], but that he had been the one to make the clones. The intent behind his usage of Lunasia as a cloning specimen becomes clearer from Chapter 13 on, once it is revealed that he is in fact the brother to the original Lunasia (and in turn, daughter of [[Rudolf von Oberstein]]).[/spoiler]
[spoiler]The events in Cartesian Theater and Angular Gyrus (Chapter 15.2/15.4) would see Lunasia return through the possession of M4A1's body, for reasons which this wiki page is not fit to explain.[/spoiler]

Shares a similar name to one of the Three Goddesses of [[Codename: Bakery Girl]], translated into English as Lunasia too (露尼西亚 in GF vs. 露尼西娅 in Bakery Girl; the distinction has prompted some to continue using the older fan-translation of Lunixya for this character). She's otherwise distinguished as "Test Subject G-264 Lunasia".

h4. Appearance

* !post #6584844: Young Lunasia
* !post #6584804: "Poincaré Recurrence" event hologram (M4A1-inspired) 

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Lunasia":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Lunasia]

A Nyto type that first appeared in the Continuum Turbulence event. Is dressed in white unlike her breathen and uses a large scythe for her attacks, utilizing the skill "Polarday" in battle; often referred to as Polarday within the community as a result. Otherwise referred to as "Nyto White" in the in-game Enemy Units Index, and granted the name Alina following Protocol Assimilation.

A higher-level Nyto, she commands the [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s during the events of Continuum Turbulence, and afterward often appears as a sub-commander to whomever is actually leading charge.

title: destroyer_(girls'_frontline)
body:
The [[Sangvis Ferri]] boss you fight in [[Girls' Frontline]]'s 5th Chapter, Model SP5NANO. Often appears alongside [[Dreamer (girls' frontline)|]], who treats her in a toxic fashion, yet simultaneously can't leave her be. During Deep Dive, Destroyer ends up getting uploaded into two bodies to fight off against their enemies - firstly into [[Cerberus (girls' frontline)|]], after being tricked into doing so, and then secondly into [[Gaia (girls' frontline)|]]. 

[quote][b]Enemy Bio:[/b]

An expert in blowing things up and disarming bombs who also possesses decent combat abilities. Occasionally teams up with Alchemist. She's usually haughty and sharp-tongued, but is actually a tsundere with a somewhat childish temper. She cries under pressure and is very sensitive about her height.

[b]Protocol Assimilation Bio:[/b]

An expert in detonation and disarming bombs who has some unique insight into the art of blowing things up. She is a sharp-tongued tsundere with a somewhat childish temper. She is also extremely competitive and enjoys trampling on the weak. To achieve her aims, she never skimps on firepower in battle.

Her voice actress is [[Takada Yuuki]].[/quote]

She's the third to receive a variant unit through Protocol Assimilation, in the form of [[Destroyer (Dashing Reindeer) (girls' frontline)|Dashing Reindeer]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6043566: Default
* !post #6043567: 5* Protocol Assimilation
* !post #4992763: [[Gaia (girls' frontline)|]]
* !post #6043531: [[Destroyer (Dashing Reindeer) (girls' frontline)|Dashing Reindeer]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Destroyer":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Destroyer]
other_names: デストロイヤー(ドールズフロントライン)

title: hata_no_kokoro
body:
The "Expressive Poker Face." Final boss of [[Touhou]] 13.5, [[Hopeless Masquerade]], and also a playable character in that game.

She is a "menreiki":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menreiki, a kind of youkai who was born from the legendary masks of "Hata no Kawakatsu":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hata_no_Kawakatsu. She has the ability to manipulate emotions, but [[expressionless|cannot express emotion with her own face]]; rather, she relies on her collection of sixty-six [[mask]]s to show her feelings, each representing a different emotion.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24666639: [[Hopeless Masquerade]]
* !post #2008985: [[Urban Legend in Limbo]]
* !post #6485155: [[Touhou Lostword]]
* !post #3458509: Annotated masks

* [[hannya]]

body:

Would receive a [[Type 64 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], Type 64 appears as [[Souchun (neural cloud)|]] / Camellia.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[parted hair|parted]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[green shirt|green]] [[collared shirt]], [[ammunition pouch]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], with [[collar tabs]], [[red armband]], [[headphones]] with a [[red star]] on it, [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], [[knee pads]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[knee boots]].

title: ags-30_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A Heavy Ordnance Corp, consisting of a trio of dolls manning a Russian [[AGS-30]] Grenade Launcher, in [[Girls' Frontline]].

All of them wear a distinctive [[digital camouflage]], [[military uniform]] underneath the [[load bearing vest]] with a white necktie. They have brown hair, but each of them has a distinctive hairstyle. They each also have hair decorations that looks like tripods as well. Their artist has also granted each a name, but these are artist headcanon until mentioned in-game.

The "loader" has twintails. She has brown eyes, wears red-trim glasses, black socks (as seen on her chibi sprite), and carries a red ID (with the name Alina).

The "spotter" has a side-ponytail. She has blue eyes, wears white thighhighs (as seen on her chibi sprite), and, unlike her other 2 "sisters", wears no glasses. She carries a blue ID (with the name Galina).

The "gunner" has a ponytail. She has red eyes, wears black thighhighs, glasses, and carries an orange ID (with the name Sonya).

h4. Appearance

* !post #5533626

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: AGS-30":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/AGS-30]

title: svt-38_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Russian-made [[SVT-38]] [[rifle]] in the game [[Girls' Frontline]].

SVT-38 has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], and [[aqua eyes]] hidden behind a pair of dark [[sunglasses]]. She wears a [[white vest|white]] [[vest]] over a [[black shirt|black]] [[turtleneck]] with [[long sleeves]], and a white [[fur-trimmed capelet]] over that. She also wears [[white gloves|white]] [[fur-trimmed gloves]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]], [[side-seamed legwear|side-seamed]] [[white legwear|white]] [[leggings]] (or possibly just [[tight pants]]), and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[cross-laced footwear|lace-up]] [[knee boots]]. Additionally, she carries her SVT-38 [[rifle]] on a long [[strap]] and some extra [[bullet]]s for it attached to a [[thigh strap]].

Often depicted alongside the other Russian T-Dolls/gungirls.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2583529

body:

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[light brown hair]], [[brown eyes]] and [[medium breasts]]. She wears a [[black dress|black]], [[collared dress|collared]] [[frilled dress]] with a [[puffy short sleeves]] with a [[hoop skirt|hoop]] around it. She also wears [[black gloves]], a [[frilled hairband]], [[mismatched legwear]] with [[garter straps|garter strap]] on right  and [[legwear garter]] on the left, and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform shoes]].

A very flirtatious girl, nearly all her in-game lines have heavy shades of [[femdom]] towards the Commander as well as the enemy. When dealt heavy damage and during repairs she shows her [[masochism|masochist]] side. Would receive a [[PPK (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

title: instant_ramen
body:
A form of ramen sold in a dry, precooked block, the most common form of "instant noodles". Invented in Japan in 1958 by [[Nissin]], it has since spread to other countries, examples include America's "Top Ramen" and Britain's "Super Noodles".

The [[instant noodle block]] is generally sold in two sorts of packaging, [[pack noodles]] (generally in square packs, sometimes sold in bulk) or [[cup ramen]] (generally sold in a cup- or bowl-shaped container).

h4. Instant noodle brands

title: noodles
body:
A staple food made from dough (whether made with bread wheat, durum wheat, buckwheat, rice, etc. and may or may not include eggs), which is prepared in various ways depending on the type of noodle (one example being rolled flat and made into long thin strips), then boiled in water until done (whether al dente or not). Popular types of noodles include Central European noodles such as spaetzle, Italian [[pasta]] such as [[spaghetti]], and East Asian noodles such as [[ramen]].

title: steamed_bun
body:
A type of steamed, filled bun or bread-like [[dumpling]] originating in China, with regional varieties in many world cuisines. There are many variations in fillings ([[meat]] or vegetarian) and preparation (usually steamed).

In China, it is known as [i]baozi[/i]. It is derived from the traditional Chinese [[mantou]], a steamed bun without fillings (although regionally [i]mantou[/i] may refer to baozi as well).

In Japan, it is known as [i]manjuu[/i], the Japanese rendering of [i]mantou[/i]. A meat-filled [i]manjuu[/i] is a [i]nikuman[/i]; those referred to as [i]manjuu[/i] typically have a sweet filling. 

In [[Love Live! School Idol Project]], sweet [i]manjuu[/i] is the signature item of Homura Bakery, which [[Kosaka Honoka]]'s family owns and lives over. Good Smile Company, as a result, produced official Homura Bakery [i]manjuu[/i] in packs.

Other names for baozi include bao, bau, humbow, nunu, pow or pau.

h4. Examples

title: ibaraki_kasen
body:
"The One-Armed, Horned Sennin"

Introduced in the official comic [i]東方茨歌仙 ([[Touhou]] Ibarakasen) ～ [[Wild and Horned Hermit]][/i], serialized in Chara☆Mel Febri. An enigmatic [[pink hair|pink haired]], [[red eyes|red-eyed]] (or [[pink eyes|pink]]) "pilgrim" with her right [[bandaged arm|arm]] wrapped in [[bandages]] whose search for the "Kappa Arm" led her into the Hakurei Shrine. It is soon revealed that [[amputee|there is no arm inside her bandages]], which are instead filled with a mysterious magical smoke. She wears a [[tabard]] with a [[red rose]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] and a [[green skirt]]. Her appetite for [[steamed bun]]s also has her frequently depicted with [[large breasts]] and/or [[eating]].

Due to the [[shackles|shackle]] on her left arm, her suspicious [[double bun]]s with [[bun cover]]s, and her title implying the existence of horns, there is rampant speculation among fans that Kasen is an [[oni]], specifically [[Ibaraki Douji_(mythology)|]], one of the Big Four. Some of Kasen's actions, such as her avoidance of [[Ibuki Suika]], also contribute to the speculation.

She is often accompanied by her pets: [[Koutei (touhou)|]] the dragon, [[Kume (touhou)|]] the giant eagle, [[Kanda (touhou)|]] the young eagle, [[Mukou (touhou)|]] the raijuu, and [[Houso (touhou)|]] the tiger.

Since both characters are hermits, Kasen is often associated with [[Kaku Seiga]], though usually on an antagonistic basis since Seiga is a "wicked hermit". 

[spoiler]Wild and Horned Hermit 35 revealed she is one of the Sages of [[Gensokyo]] alongside Yukari.[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Wild and Horned Hermit 49 would not only introduce her severed arm given semi-physical form, [[Ibaraki Douji's Arm]], but Kasen herself would become one with her arm and fully become an oni once more, revealing herself to be one of the Big Four, [[Ibaraki Douji (Touhou)|Ibaraki Douji]]. Also associated with [[Miyako Yoshika]] as the real Miyako No Yoshika wrote poems that Douji supposedly liked. [/spoiler]

Playable in Touhou 14.5 ~ Urban Legend in Limbo.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Kasen Ibaraki":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kasen_Ibaraki

title: dim_sum
body:
A style of Chinese cuisine prepared as small bite-sized portions of food served in small [[bamboo steamer]] baskets or on small [[plate]]s. Dim sum dishes are usually served with [[tea]], and together form a full tea brunch.

They can be cooked by steaming and frying, among other methods. A dim sum brunch includes various types of small [[steamed bun]]s, rice or wheat [[dumpling]]s, "rice noodle roll":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rice_noodle_roll], "chicken feet":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicken_feet], "pork spare ribs":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spare_ribs], steamed green vegetables, roasted meats, congee and other soups, "glutinous rice dishes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glutinous_rice] and [[sweets]] such as [[egg tart]], [[pudding]], [[sponge]], [[cake]]. The serving sizes are usually small and normally served as three or four pieces in one dish.

Use this tag when the dishes are displayed in brunch.

h4. Examples

* !post #1971968

h4. See also

* [[Chinese food]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: wonton
body:

title: dumpling
body:
A dish that consists of small pieces of cooked [[dough]], often wrapped around a filling. Dumplings may be prepared using a variety of cooking methods and are found in many world cuisines.

Dumplings may be savory or sweet and can be eaten by themselves, with [[gravy]] or [[sauce]], or in [[soup]]s or [[stew]]s.
