* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

title: kufei
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 12 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is an extremely skilled Chinese martial artist who is very energetic and joyful. She is friends with [[Chao Lingshen]], and works with her and [[Yotsuba Satsuki]] at the Chao Bao Zi Chinese restaurant cart, where she also gorges on [[steamed bun|nikuman]].

It is a language barrier that holds her back from succeeding in class. But she can also be rather absent minded.

She has [[dark skin]] and [[green eyes]] with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blonde hair]] styled in a [[two side up]] hairstyle.

She is "Baka Yellow" in the [[mahora_baka_rangers|Baka Rangers]] study group.

title: sie_kensou
body:
The secondary character of [[Psycho Soldier]] and one of the characters in [[The King of Fighters]]. He is sometimes depicted carrying or eating a [[steamed bun]].

He claims himself to be [[Asamiya Athena]]'s love interest, only to get unlucky later on.

title: chao_lingshen
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 19 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in six Clubs as the Mahora Academy and is seen as a Happy-go-Lucky, very busy girl. She also runs the Chao Bao Zi Chinese restaurant cart with [[KuFei]] and [[Yotsuba Satsuki]], making her famous [[steamed bun|nikuman]]. And despite her busy schedule she still remains the Top ranking student in the school.

She is a master in Chinese martial arts.  Her origins are mysterious.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair|black]]/[[brown hair]] in a [[double bun]], usually with in [[bun cover]]s and [[braid|braids]] by each bun.

title: longevity_peach_bun
body:
A [[steamed bun]] that resembles a [[peach]], usually with a sweet filling. It's a representation of the Peaches of Immortality from Chinese folk legends, thus traditionally and commonly used on birthdays.

title: don_quijote_(store)
body:
A discount chain store in [[Japan]], often referred to by its shortened name Donki (ドンキ). Donki stores provide a wide range of products, from basic groceries to electronics and clothing.

Notable for its distinct merchandising strategy, "theme song":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lUsJsealYxM and frequent appearance through the [[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]] series.

h4. See also

* [[Donpen]], an official mascot
* [[Don Quixote (novel)|]], a 1605 Spanish novel by Miguel de Cervantes.

h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://www.donki.com/en/]
* "Wikipedia: Don Quijote":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Quijote_(store)]

title: bamboo_steamer
body:
A round or oval cookware made from [[bamboo]] with a lattice bottom and a cover. They are often stacked on top of each other so that the steam can cook many different servings simultaneously.

Often used to make [[dim sum]].

Called [i]mushiki[/i] (蒸し器) in Japanese.

title: hachune_miku
body:
The chibi blank faced version of [[Vocaloid]] [[Hatsune Miku]]. She is drawn in the big faced, [[o_o|white eyed]] style made famous by doujin circle Harukaze Kouho.

Hachune Miku first appeared in [[NicoNico]] through the Ievan Polka song, spinning a stalk of [[spring onion]] reminiscent of Orihime ([[Bleach]]), which spread to a meme called [[leekspin (meme)|]].

This video permanently tied spring onions to Hatsune Miku.

h6. Ievan Polkka (Eva's Polka) - Hatsune Miku

* "NicoNico video":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm982882
* "Youtube video":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kbbA9BhCTko

h4. See also

title: seeu
body:
SeeU is a Korean [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by SBS A&T, and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine.

She was developed to be bilingual, having Japanese capabilities.

Her appearance was designed by [[KKUEM]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and a cat lip. She has [[speaker]]s shaped like [[cat ears]], orange [[wrist cuffs]], and a [[grey bow]].  She wears an [[orange shirt|orange]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[shoes]].

h4. See also

* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

title: habit
body:
Ambigous tag, previously used to refer to religious garments, most commonly the religious garments worn by Christian [[nun]]s. However, habit here broadly refers to the whole range of garments which exist for those involved in religious institutions, whether it be the clergy or religious brothers and sisters. These garments are typically tagged using the religious position in question. For those tags, please go to:

* [[nun]]
** [[buddhist nun]]
* [[monk]]
* [[priest]]
* [[priestess]]
* [[pope]]

title: nun
body:
A lay woman who has taken special vows committing her to a religious life, otherwise known as a religious sister. They must adopt a celibate life, refraining from marriage and sexual relationships - a religious sister takes part in a religious institution, while a nun lives a cloistered monastic life. They are recognized by their distinctive set of garments, called a habit. Christian ones can be additionally recognized by the appearance of a [[cross]] or [[crucifix]].

The term "nun" is applicable to Catholics – both eastern and western traditions – Orthodox Christians, Anglicans, Lutherans, Jains, [[buddhist nun|Buddhists]], and Taoists. Nuns can vary in appearance not just across each tradition, but within traditions as well; common subtypes of nuns across traditions include military nuns (or battle/combat/warrior nuns).

See [[traditional nun]] for the traditional modest Christian nun outfit, as opposed to the sexualized nun outfits typically seen in anime.

h4. Examples

* !post #7501316: nontraditional nun

* !post #8104204: [[latin cross|latin]]  [[cross necklace]]

These are common among [[traditional nun]]s in set colors, but nontraditional designs may feature different things, simplified versions of the things featured here, etc. in non-standard colors.

title: kokkoro_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from Princess Connect! Re:Dive (she did not appear in the original [[Princess Connect!]]). She also appears in [[Granblue Fantasy]] as a special event character.

The official romanization is "Kokkoro", but sometimes her name is spelled "Coccoro" by fans.

She is a short and slender [[elf]] with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] with [[antenna hair]] & [[hair between eyes]], and [[pink eyes]]. She usually wears a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[green dress|green]] & [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]], light [[green sleeves|green]] [[detached sleeves]], and a [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower]].

In the anime adaptation, she is memetically associated with the [[x mouth]] expression, which she frequently uses (she does not do this in the game.)

Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[Kokkoro (real) (princess connect!)|Natsume Kokoro]].

h4. Appearance

title: curry_rice
body:
[[Rice]] topped with [[curry]].

The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] adopted curry from the [[Royal Navy]], who adopted it from India, and it became the origin of present Japanese-style curry rice. The [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]]'s tradition of eating curry rice every Friday lunch originated with the IJN.

h4. Popular toppings for Japanese curry

* ton[[katsu (food)|]] or [[chicken (food)|]] katsu
* [[shrimp tempura|fried prawn]]
* [[egg (food)|sliced boiled eggs]]
* [[fukujinzuke]]

h4. See also

* [[Currymeshi]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: cup_ramen
body:
A ready-to-eat, no-cook food composed of instant [[noodles]], typically [[instant ramen|ramen]] noodles, complete with flavoring, contained in insulated foam or plastic containers, which are typically cup- or bowl-shaped. Just add hot water and wait three minutes before eating, though some brands instruct to just add water and place into a microwave for three minutes before eating.

For [[Nissin]]'s cup ramen brand, use "[[nissin cup noodle]]" instead.

h4. See also

* [[pack noodles]]
* [[instant ramen]]
* [[instant udon]]
* [[instant soba]]
* [[Jagariko]] - potato snack that's sold in cup container
* [[Currymeshi]] - [[instant rice|instant]] [[curry rice]] that's sold in a cup container
* [[Tag group:Food tags]]
* [[noodle stopper]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cup noodle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cup_noodle

body:

Not to be confused with [[shiruko (food)|shiruko]], soup made of azuki beans.

title: soba
body:
Japanese buckwheat [[noodles]]. They can be served either chilled with [[mamezara|dipping sauce]] or in hot broth. Soba is often complimented with different toppings to represent the season it is served in, as buckwheat can only be harvested four times in the year.

It is customary to eat soba on New Year's Eve to cut off the hardships of the year as soba is easily cut while eating.

title: curry
body:
Derived from the Tamil word "khari" (meaning 'gravy' or 'sauce'), curry is a generic term used to describe a variety of usually spiced dishes in South Asian cooking, especially Indian. In Japanese cuisine, it is usually eaten (and depicted in anime) as "[[curry rice]]," a portion of rice served with curry on top.

title: watson_amelia
body:
A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoMyth]]. Designed by [[Nabi (UZ02)|]].

A [[detective]] time traveler with a [[Sherlock Holmes]] motif. Refers to herself as "Amelia Watson" to make her name sound more natural for English-speaking viewers. Also known as "Ame" for short.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], hiding [[large breasts|a sizable bust]] under the layers of clothing. Her default hairstyle is a [[bob cut]] with a monocle [[hair ornament]].

Despite being called "the most normal-looking" and "oddball" out of the other [[HoloMyth]] debut (due to her not being a monster girl), she is actually the most chaotic of the bunch. She also likes to make jokes and banter, giving rise to her connection with the [[ground pound]] meme.

Her mascot and pet dog [[Bubba (watson amelia)|]] can occasionally be heard during her streams. She also has a pet cat named [[Wellington (watson amelia)|]].

Due to their frequent collaborations and chemistry both in videos and on Twitter, it is common to see her coupled with [[Gawr Gura]], a ship known as "AmeSame". Fans were quick to also compare her to [[Akai Haato]] due to their similar chaotic nature, which extends to collabs.

She reached one million subscribers on February 11 (JST) / 10 (PST) 2021.

Her general activities ended on September 30th, 2024, but she did not fully "graduate" and is still affiliated with Cover Corp, participating in future projects.

h4. Costumes

h5. Regular costumes

title: goddess_of_victory:_nikke
body:
A Korean mobile third-person shooter role-playing game, developed by Shift Up and published by Level Infinite, a subsidiary of Tencent. Development began as early as 2017 and being officially released on November 4, 2022 for Android and iOS, and on February 15, 2023 for the PC port.

Players are put into the shoes of a [[commander (nikke)|]] of advanced androids called "Nikkes" and is tasked with fighting back against [[Rapture (nikke)|Raptures]], mysterious robotic organisms that have driven humanity underground following a devastating war, and reclaiming the surface.

One of the popular abbreviations for the game's title in Japanese is メガニケ (MegaNikke; with mega being the short for 女神, megami).

h4.See also

title: airship
body:
A type of fantasy [[aircraft]] or [[spacecraft]] from the [[fantasy]] or [[science fiction]] genres. Often, airships look similar to real [[ship]]s, except flying in the air or space through magical or fantastical means. For reference, the [[Palanquin ship]] and the [[Yamato (uchuu senkan yamato)|Space Battleship Yamato]] are the archtypical example of an airship.

This tag is not for real life blimps, but for fictional flying ships. For real life blimps, use [[dirigible]]. When in doubt, or when the vehicle exhibit characteristic of both vehicle types, apply both [[dirigible]] and [[airship]], or just use the [[aircraft]] tag.

[[Flying boat]]s are not to be confused with airships; they are a variation of [[seaplane]].

h4. Examples

* !post #2059669: [[Palanquin ship]] 
* !post #5613871: [[Yamato (uchuu senkan yamato)|Space Battleship Yamato]]
* !post #3651112: A "[[blimp]] airship" with a large gas bag similar to that of a [[dirigible]].

h4. See also

* [[aircraft]]
* [[dirigible]]
* [[landship]]
* [[spacecraft]]

title: yamato_(uchuu_senkan_yamato)
body:
[b]Space Battleship Yamato[/b] is the title [[spacecraft]]/[[airship]] from the anime series [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] and the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] remake. In real life it was designed by [[Matsumoto Leiji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].
 
In the series, the Space Battleship Yamato was created by the [i]Earth Defense Force[/i] in the late 22nd century. At this time our planet was under attack from an alien race, the [[Gamilas]], who were raining down [[meteor bomb]]s that evaporated Earth's oceans and rendered its surface uninhabitable. 

The new space warship was built inside the remains of the Japanese [[battleship]] [[Yamato (battleship)|]] (sunk during World War II in the sea near Okinawa) which was partially buried in what was now a dry seabed, thus concealing it from the view of the orbiting Gamilon vessels. The Space Battleship Yamato was finally launched on the year 2199.

In the American dub of the series, [[uchuu_senkan_yamato|Star Blazers]], the spaceship has the same origin but is named the [b]Argo[/b] (after the mythical ship "Argo" from [[greek_mythology|Jason and the Argonauts]]). In Spanish and Latin American countries its name was changed to [b]Intrepido[/b] ("Intrepid").

h4. See also

* [[Wave Motion Gun]]

title: al_pastor
body:
Al pastor (from Spanish, "shepherd style") is a preparation of [[vertical rotisserie|spit-grilled]] slices of [[pork]], originating in the Central Mexican region of [[State of Puebla|Puebla]] and [[Mexico City]]. Today, it is a common menu item found in [[taqueria]]s throughout [[Mexico]], in the form of [b][[taco]]s al pastor[/b], or tacos de trompo.

h4. See also

* [[Doner kebab]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Al pastor":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_pastor]

title: doner_kebab
body:
A popular Eastern Mediterranean [[cooking]] method, done by cutting [[meat]] into thin slices, stacked in a cone-like shape, and roasted on a slowly-turning [[vertical rotisserie|vertical]] [[rotisserie]] or spit. Traditionally made with lamb or mutton, it may also be made with [[chicken (food)|]], [[beef]], turkey, or veal (pork can even be an option if made by non-Muslims). Thin slices are shaved off the cooked surface as it continuously rotates, which are then used in various [[food|dish]]es.

This method has many names, from the original Turkish name of 'döner kebab', the Middle Eastern 'shawarma', and the Greek 'gyros', with the first two used as synonyms of the other in other languages. It is common for dishes that use the meat made with this method, whichever way it is referred to, to be referred to with that name as well, most famously [[pita (food)|flatbread]] [[doner sandwich|sandwich]]es and [[doner wrap|wrap]]s.

h4. See also

* [[al pastor]]
* [[doner sandwich]]
* [[doner wrap]]
* [[shish kebab]]
* [[sliced meat]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Doner kebab":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doner_kebab and "Shawarma":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shawarma

title: doner_wrap
body:
A popular Eastern Mediterranean dish. It features [[doner kebab|meat cooked]] on a [[vertical rotisserie]], slowly turning and creating crispy, flavorful layers. The meat is shaved off as it cooks, and typically served with warm [[pita (food)|]] bread (or another type of flatbread) wrapped around it with fresh vegetables and a creamy sauce, like tzatziki.

Most well-known in the West by its Greek name, '[b]gyros[/b]', which is a translation of the Turkish 'döner', while in Turkey, it is known as 'dürüm kebab', referring to the rolled-up nature of the wrap; otherwise also referred to as 'shawarma', or even just 'kebab'.

h4. See also

* [[doner kebab]]
* [[doner sandwich]]
* [[shish kebab]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Gyros":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyros] and "Dürüm":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/D%C3%BCr%C3%BCm]

title: doner_sandwich
body:
A popular dish originating from Turkey, popularized in the West by Turkish immigrants in Germany. It features [[doner kebab|meat cooked]] on a [[vertical rotisserie]], slowly turning and creating crispy, flavorful layers. The meat is shaved off as it cooks and typically served in a warm [[pita (food)|]] bread with fresh vegetables and a creamy sauce. Often just referred to as a 'döner', 'shawarma', or even just 'kebab'.

h4. See also

* [[doner kebab]]
* [[doner wrap]]
* [[shish kebab]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Doner kebab":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doner_kebab and "Shawarma":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shawarma

title: kiryu_coco
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holoforce|4th generation]]. A [[dragon girl]] in human form. Designed by [[Yaman]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[orange hair]] with a single [[blonde hair|yellow]] [[streaked hair|lock of hair]] near her forehead. Her regular hairstyle is [[straight hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair intakes]] held with a [[black hairband]], [[fanged bangs|fanged]] [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]]. She also has a pair of [[dragon horns]] with a [[horn bow|bow]] on her right horn, [[pointy ears]], [[red eyes]] with [[white pupils|white]] [[slit pupils]], a long purple [[dragon tail]] (which she had a running gag of it being a [[butt plug]] [[anal tail|tail]]). She also has quite [[large breasts]], with her subsequent outfits making them [[huge breasts|noticeably larger]].

She is fluent in English, and quite eccentric (due to being a half-American). Hosted a morning "news show"-esque 20-minute program on weekdays named "AsaCoco" (Morning Coco), which usually ended up creating absurd memes - such as [[Himemori Luna]]'s English Corner, where the cute, childish princess constantly spews out obscenities, and most notably the drug "[[asacoco]]", a potent stimulant available to be delivered in a wide variety of forms ranging from needles to anal plugs.

Despite her wild antics, insane gags and frequent foul language (which often got her into trouble with YouTube), she is very eager to help her friends if need be and has a mature, big sister-like approach to troublesome situations (though usually laced with some of her personal brand of humor to break the seriousness if it's too much).

She was considered to have the second largest bust in hololive after [[Tsukumo Sana]], even toppling [[Shirogane Noel]]'s K-night cups. She was also significantly taller than the rest of the hololive girls (180 cm, compared with [[Omega Alpha]], who is the second tallest at 175 cm without counting the gigantic Sana), especially the rest of the 4th generation (Kanata, Towa and Watame are all about 150 cm tall, Luna is the shortest at 140 cm, boosted to 150 cm with her shoes and crown).

She was the real-life roommate of [[Amane Kanata]], and the apartment that they lived in together was called by other visiting hololive members as the "KanaCoco House". This means that they could (and had several times) make appearances on each other's streams.

She is in fact a big [[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]] fangirl and has been known to play games of the series. In fact, her name and her title of "Chairwoman" ("会長" - [i]Kaichou[/i]) are direct references to [[Kiryu Kazuma]].

Kiryu Coco reached one million YouTube subscribers on February 17, 2021.

She announced her graduation from Hololive on June 8, 2021. Her final act was a live concert on July 1, 2021, which became one of the most viewed live streams in Hololive and VTuber history, reaching over 498,000 concurrent viewers.

title: katsu_(food)
body:
A breaded, deep-fried [[meat]] cutlet. This is usually a pork cutlet (豚カツ, [i]tonkatsu[/i]), but there are other versions including chicken and beef. 

Commonly served with shredded [[cabbage]] and a thick brown [[sauce]], or on a [[rice bowl]] as [[katsudon (food)|]], or with [[curry]] as [[katsu curry]], or as a [[katsu sandwich]].

Not to be confused with [i]tonkotsu ramen[/i], which is [[ramen]] topped with [[char-siu]] (sliced pork belly).

title: chicago_police_department
body:
The Chicago Police Department is the primary law enforcement agency for the City of Chicago and is one of the more well-known departments in operation within the [[United States]]. It is headed by a Superintendent. The department traces its roots back to 1835, making the CPD one of the oldest modern police forces in the world.

The Chicago Police Department is organized into numerous districts and 6 bureaus to address different aspects of law enforcement. 

h4. External Links
* "Official website of the Chicago Police Department":[https://home.chicagopolice.org/]

title: atelier_resleriana
body:
[b]Atelier Resleriana: Forgotten Alchemy and the Polar Night Liberator[/b] is the 25th mainline game in the [[atelier (series)|Atelier series]], developed by Akatsuki Games and published by Koei Tecmo. The story is penned by novelist Takahiro, with character designs by [[Umiu Geso]], [[tokki]], and [[NOCO_(adamas)|]]. Unlike previous mainline entries in the series, it is a free-to-play game with monetization centered around a gacha system.

It follows the story of the two titular protagonists: [[Resna Sternenlicht]], a novice alchemist who hopes to revive the concept of alchemy, and [[Valeria (atelier)|]], an adventurer who's lost most of her memories up to three years before the events of the game.

The game was released in Japan on September 23, 2023 for mobile devices, and on January 10, 2024 for PC through Steam. The global version was released worldwide on January 25, 2024 for both mobile devices and PC. The global version was "shut down":https://x.com/Resleriana_EN/status/1883818691709796796 on March 28, 2025.

The game heavily features characters from the wider Atelier series mysteriously transported into the world, known collectively as "wanderers".

title: wish_for_blooming_together
body:
A limited-time event in [[Link! Like! Love Live!]].

[[Hinoshita Kaho]] asks for help from everyone to petition the Love Live! management to allow [[Ceras Yanagida Lilienfeld]], a third-year in middle school, to participate in the Love Live! playoffs as one of Mizukawa's school idols, so her dream can come true, because Mizukawa High School is closing down come the next school year.

The petition succeeded, and Ceras was allowed to participate alongside [[Katsuragi Izumi]] as Edel Note.

title: chengdu_j-36
body:
The [b]"Chengdu J-36"[/b] is a placeholder designation given to a Chinese prototype stealth [[fighter jet]] developed for the [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]]. The aircraft made its first public appearance on 26 December 2024, coinciding with the birthday of [[Mao Zedong]].

The aircraft is very unusual in design, being a tailless flying delta wing trijet. It is speculated to be a part of the development program for the sixth-generation fighter for the PLAAF.

title: ore_no_imouto_ga_konna_ni_kawaii_wake_ga_nai
body:
[b]Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai[/b] (俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない, lit. [i]My Little Sister Can't Be This Cute[/i], abbrev. [i]OreImo[/i]) is a light novel series written by Fushimi Tsukasa, with illustrations by [[Kanzaki Hiro]]. Also adapted into a 2009 manga, with illustrations by [[Ikeda Sakura]], and a 2010 anime.

For years, 17-year-old [[Kousaka Kyousuke]] and his 14-year-old sister [[kousaka_kirino|Kirino]] rarely, if ever, talked to each other, until the day Kyousuke picks up a mahou-shoujo anime DVD case Kirino dropped, only to find out that it actually contains a little sister incest H-game. The ensuing chain of events finally force the siblings to have their first serious conversation in years.

h4. Characters

title: sunday_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character, and [[brother and sister|brother]] to [[Robin (Honkai: Star Rail)|]]. Voiced by [[Ootsuka Takeo]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[grey hair|grey]]/light [[blue hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[head wings]], and a [[halo]]. His default outfit consists of a [[grey shirt]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket]], [[white gloves]], [[earrings]], [[white pants]] with a single [[white belt|white]] [[thigh belt]] on his left leg, and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

His playable version replaces his white pants with [[black pants|black]] ones, while his gloves also turn [[black gloves|black]]. His thigh belt is now colored [[blue belt|blue]] and is moved to his right leg. 

[spoilers]As of Patch 2.7 after becoming a playable character, he is currently residing in the [[Astral Express (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] as a passenger.[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance

* !post #8651686: Splash art (playable)
* !post #8768138: Original outfit (from "After the Charmony Fall" Light Cone)
* !post #8534587: [[Sunday (Brilliant Youth) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Brilliant Youth]]

h4. See also 
* [[Septimus (honkai: star rail)|]] [b](Spoiler alert)[/b]

title: jing_yuan
body:
A [i][[Honkai: Star Rail]][/i] character. 

One of the seven generals of the Xianzhou Alliance's Cloud Knights and one of the Six Charioteers of the Luofu. Voiced by [[Ono Daisuke]] (JP) and [[Cy Yu|Alejandro Saab]] (EN).

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied to a [[ponytail]], and [[yellow eyes]]. His outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] worn with [[shoulder armor]] and [[pauldrons]], [[black belt]], [[red pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] tying his ponytail.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7690439: Base art
* !post #8768157: Before Dawn (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
Although his appearance may be one of indolence, the Cloud Knight general who commands the Xianzhou Luofu is more meticulous than seemingly meets the eye.

He does not consider saving a situation from the brink of disaster to be a show of wisdom, and is thus fastidious with routine affairs to avoid any potential problems.

Due to his careful management, the Xianzhou have enjoyed many years of peace, with Jing Yuan's seemingly lazy demeanor having earned him the moniker of "Dozing General."
[/expand]

title: battle_mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Bellatrix or Astarte.

Her default appearance has high-set twintails, while her outfit consists of a short black jacket, red dress vest, black shorts, and jewelled gauntlets.

As an Astarte, her hair is generally longer and she wears a black and red one-piece with a long skirt and black shorts.

As a Neo Battle Mage, she wears fancier robes with gold trim and black thighhighs. Her older alter ego, an avatar of the goddess Teana, is reflected underneath her.

In all of her official appearances, she wields a spear of some variety, her weapon of choice.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660957: Default
* !asset #24660956: Astarte
* !asset #24660959: Neo Battle Mage

title: sparkle_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]] and in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] (via crossover event). 

A Masked Fool who follows Aha, the Aeon of Elation. Goes by the name "Hanabi" ("Firework") in Japanese. Voiced by [[Ueda Reina]] (JP) and [[Lizzie Freeman]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[pink eyes]] with [[butterfly-shaped pupils]], [[small breasts|small]]/[[medium breasts]], and [[facial mark]]s under her eyes. Her default outfit is [[Japanese clothes|Japanese-themed]] and comprises a [[black choker]] with a [[jingle bell]], [[red dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], dark purple [[obi]], [[black gloves]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sandals]], and a [[fox mask]].

title: ange_katrina_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Ange Katrina]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/ange_katrina_/status/1374022334978297861].

In this costume, she wears a [[white coat|white]] [[lab coat]] worn over a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[dress shirt]], a [[black skirt]], [[thigh straps]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], she has [[long hair|longer hair]] then her other costumes.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660909: Profile (with lab coat)
* !asset #24660928: Profile (without lab coat)

In this costume, she wears a [[red dress|red]] [[frilled dress]] with a [[pink shirt]] worn underneath, [[pink socks]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

title: honkai_impact_3rd_icon_parody
body:
Images that intend to [[parody]] the [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] app icon. Signature traits include a [[portrait]] view, [[yellow background]], the focused character holding a [[finger gun]] to the viewer (though not always necessary) and company or game name across the bottom.

This tag can also be used when the image loosely fits the traits (such as in the case of post #6578643) or is a full art piece referencing the icon (such as in the case of post #6832961).

* !asset #24660771

body:

In this costume, she wears a [[red jacket|red]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]], a [[black skirt]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660793: Profile (without jacket)

title: female_nen_master_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Fighter_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Blazing Flower or Nen Empress.

Her default appearance features an orange and white [[china dress]], with her hair done up in a [[half_updo|half updo]]. She wears jeweled gloves, which presumably helps her control and weaponize Nen.

As a Nen Empress, she wears a black [[china dress]] and [[black thighhighs]], with her hair now styled as a [[double bun]] and [[twintails]].

Her Neo Nen Master form goes back to a white [[china dress]], with the twintails now undone. Her thigh-highs include gold [[eastern_dragon|Eastern dragon]] wrappings.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660774: Default
* !asset #24660775: Nen Empress
* !asset #24660776: Neo Nen Master
other_names: 女ネンマスター(アラド戦記)

title: dnf_duel
body:
[b]DNF Duel[/b] is a fighting game developed by [[Arc System Works]] and Eighting, that was released on June 28, 2022. It is a spin-off of the Korean multi-player online role-playing game (MORPG) [[Dungeon and Fighter]].

h4. Characters

title: demonic_lancer
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/3/30/Demon_Lancer_Full_Body.jpg] is a young man with dark purple hair and red eyes, wearing a gray jacket with fur trim, gray dress vest with white shirt, gray pants, and black gauntlets and greaves.

Subclasses:
* [[vanguard_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Vanguard]] (Revenant, Warlord)
* [[skirmisher (dungeon and fighter)|Skirmisher]] (Highlander, Durandal)
* [[impaler (dungeon and fighter)|Impaler]] (Abbadon, Erebus)
* [[dragoon_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Dragoon]] (Leviathan, Deimos)

title: impaler_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[demonic_lancer|Demonic Lancer]]. Also known as the Abbadon or Erebus.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/e/e2/Dark_Lancer_Art.png] has his hair parted down the middle, and a predominantly black version of his base class's outfit, minus the gauntlets. The right side of his face is pitch black, and his right eye has a slit pupil.

As an "Erebus":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/2/20/ErebusPortrait.png], he foregoes his black undershirt, revealing that the black discoloration on his face extends to parts of his chest and torso.

title: skirmisher_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[demonic_lancer|Demonic Lancer]]. Also known as the Highlander or Durandal.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/f/f2/SkirmisherPortrait.png] has his purple hair appear windswept, and he wears a short light gray jacket with a dark gray shirt and pants. He also comes equipped with gray pauldrons, gauntlets and greaves.

As a "Durandal":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/d/d9/DurandalPortrait.png], his appearance is still mostly the same, save for trading the jacket for a light gray cape and black fingerless gloves instead of gauntlets.

title: female_crusader_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[female_priest_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female Priest]]. Also known as the Evangelist or Seraphim.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/b2/Female_Crusader_Portrait.jpg] has much of her outfit recolored white and gold, with the addition of a small blue and white [[mitre]] on her head and a white top resembling a cape.

As a "Seraphim":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/6/69/Seraphim_Portrait.jpg], her black hair is now wavy, while her outfit is now predominantly white, gold, and blue, with the length of her robes going past her legs. Two pairs of gold angel wings are seen on her back.

h4. See also

* [[Male crusader (dungeon and fighter)|]]

title: male_priest_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/8/82/MalePriestPortrait.png] is a muscular man with brown short hair, sidelocks and beard. He's dressed in black and gold priest vestments, a white jacket and white pants, with a golden cross hanging around his neck.

He's voice actor is [[Kusunoki Taiten]] in Japanese version, [[Jo Gyuchun]] in Korean version and [[Liu Beichen]] in Chinese version.

Classes:
* [[male crusader (dungeon and fighter)|Crusader]] (Paladin, Saint)
* [[monk_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Monk]] (Templar, Justice)
* [[exorcist_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Exorcist]] (Hyperion, Draconid)
* [[avenger_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Avenger]] (Doom Guardian, Immortal)

title: male_crusader_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male priest (dungeon and fighter)|male Priest]]. Also known as the Paladin or Saint.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/6/6e/CrusaderPortrait.png] trades in his base class's outfit for red and white priest vestments with a white hooded cape. His hair has grown to shoulder length along with his beard.

As a "Saint":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/b/bc/Saint.png], his hair is cut short and his facial hair trimmed to a stubble, resembling his base class more. His clothes are now predominantly white, with plate armor appearing on his arms, left shoulder and legs. The golden hammer he wields is his signature weapon, the Jupiter Hammer.

As a "Neo Crusader":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/6/67/Neo-_Male_Crusader_Artwork.png], his appearance is a combination of his Crusader hairstyle and outfit and his Saint outfit's armor, along with a slight redesign of the Jupiter Hammer featuring more cross imagery.

h4. See also

* [[Female Crusader_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]

title: agent_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/2/26/Gunblader_Portrait.png] is a bespectacled middle-aged man with dark skin and short gray hair. His outfit consists of a long white jacket, green dress shirt and vest, brown leather pistol holster and utility belt, black pants and brown boots.

Subclasses:
* [[secret agent (dungeon and fighter)|Secret Agent]] (Enforcer, Executioner)
* [[troubleshooter_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Troubleshooter]] (Wild Card, Renegade)
* [[hitman_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Hitman]] (Big Boss, Godfather)
* [[specialist_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Specialist]] (Core Master, Pathfinder)

title: secret_agent_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Agent (dungeon and fighter)|]]. Also known as the Enforcer or Executioner.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/7/71/Agent_Concept_Art.png] has his hair slicked back, wearing a green military vest with a white long-sleeved undershirt, various leather pistol and magazine holsters, black pants, black boots and black gloves.

As an "Executioner":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/a/a1/Requiem_Portrait.png], his undershirt is now black and he also wears a dark gray trenchcoat.

title: specialist_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[agent (dungeon and fighter)|Agent]]. Also known as the Core Master or Pathfinder.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/0/0b/Specialist_Full_Body_Art.png] features messy, swept back hair, held back by a pair of blue goggles on his head. He wears a shorter beige coat with several pockets and blue lights on its shoulders, with similar blue lights on his brown leather belt; he otherwise appears the same as his base class.

As a "Pathfinder":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/0/08/Pathfinder_Portrait.png], he loses the goggles and leaves his messy hair down. He now wears a longer white coat and much of the remainder of his outfit has been recolored blue.

title: hitman_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[agent (dungeon and fighter)|Agent]]. Also known as the Big Boss or Godfather.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/c/ca/Hitman_Full_Body_Art.png] has a look that's almost exactly the same as his base class, with the only notable difference being that his hair is parted to the left.

As a "Godfather":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/b/b0/Godfather_Portrait.png], his hair is parted in the opposite direction and he sports an olive green coat and black dress vest. In the background, two of his fellow Agents - one in a white coat and another in black - are seen firing at off-screen enemies.

title: troubleshooter_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[agent (dungeon and fighter)|Agent]]. Also known as the Wild Card or Renegade.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/1/18/Trouble_Shooter_Concept_Art.png] gives him shoulder-length hair and [[pince-nez]] sunglasses. He trades in his white coat for a beige poncho concealing a variety of grenades underneath.

As a "Renegade":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/5/5d/Untouchable_Portrait.png], his hair has been styled into a thin ponytail, his poncho has been recolored dark gray, and his glasses were removed. He also sports a long, white cape.

title: male_launcher_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male gunner (dungeon and fighter)|Gunner]]. Also known as the Wrecking Ball or Destroyer.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/3/3b/Male_LauncherPortrait.png] is similar to his base class, with the only differences being that his right sleeve is hanging off his shoulder and a leather shoulder pad present on his left shoulder. He wields a gatling gun, being one of his sub-weapon skills.

As a "Destroyer":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/5/58/Dnf_season_4_destroyer_by_toonegeminielf-d7nu8f5.png], he wears a black military outfit with a sleeveless top and magazine harness, dual wielding a pair of laser cannons.

His "Neo Launcher":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/2/24/Neo-_Male_Launcher_Artwork.png] appearance gives him a sleeved red top, and is now wielding a railgun. In the background is a satellite cannon, one of the new skills he gains as a Neo Launcher.

title: male_mechanic_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male gunner (dungeon and fighter)|Gunner]]. Also known as the Machinist or Prime.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/b9/MechanicPortrait.png] is similar to his base class, with the purple trenchcoat's top being undone and left hanging off of his waist. Accompanying him are several small robots, which he uses in combat.

As a "Prime":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/1/1f/Dnf_season_4_prime_by_toonegeminielf-d7nu8xr.png], he now has curled hair and no longer has his purple trenchcoat, instead wearing a red hooded vest. He's also seen wielding a submachine gun, his class's weapon of choice.

His "Neo Mechanic":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/9/92/Neo-_Male_Mechanic_Artwork.png] appearance is generally the same as his Prime outfit, now wearing glasses and a long red jacket. Green goggles hang around his neck.

title: male_ranger_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male gunner (dungeon and fighter)|Gunner]]. Also known as the Raven or Desperado.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/d/d6/MaleRangerPortrait.png] features mostly the same clothing as his base class with the addition of a black cowboy hat. He wields the white-handled revolvers seen in his base class's art, with an upper body harness holstering two more revolvers.

As a "Raven":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/3/36/Dnf_season_4_raven_by_toonegeminielf-d7nu67r.png], his clothing is now black with red trimmings, swapping his old trenchcoat for an unzipped black one. Feathers from his namesake trail behind him.

His appearance as a "Neo Ranger":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/f/f8/Neo-_Male_Ranger_Artwork.png] is mostly similar to his Raven outfit, with his jacket now being zipped and parts of his clothing in tatters, presumably due to gunfire. His revolvers feature short-bladed bayonets on them, much like his [[female_ranger_(dungeon_and_fighter)|female counterpart]].

title: female_mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character.

Her default appearance is that of a young girl with pointy ears and red hair cut into blunt bangs and tied into a side tail. She wears a red and black dress, striped kneesocks, and black boots.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660662

h4. Subclasses

title: summoner_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Lunar Princess or Eclipse.

Her default appearance has her red hair cut short and swept to her left. She wears a black jacket with a simple one-piece red dress underneath and dark gray stockings with black stripes. Her myriad summons are shrouded in darkness behind her.

As an Eclipse, her short hair has [[antenna_hair|hair antennae]] added to the top of her head (some fan artists alternatively depict it as a sole [[ahoge]]). Her outfit consists of a red jacket with white sleeves, a short red top, black shorts, and white kneesocks.

As a Neo Summoner, she has a longer black jacket, red and black dress, and red thighhighs.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660710: Default
* !asset #24660711: Eclipse
* !post #5353628: Neo Summoner

title: elementalist_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Archmage or Overmind.

Her default appearance has her side tail rearranged as a ponytail, with more natural bangs held by a pair of hair clips. She wears robes with white sleeves, red torso and black bottom, with a white skirt and black thighhighs.

As an Overmind, her hair has been arranged into twintails. The colors on her top are reversed and she's now wearing white thighhighs. She also wears a black headband with gold decorations on it.

As a Neo Elementalist, her hair is almost the length of her body and has a slight orange tinge at its ends. She wears robes that are now predominantly white with gold trim and a red skirt.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660697: Default
* !asset #24660698: Overmind
* !asset #24660699: Neo Elementalist

Her default attire consists of a tricolor [[sleeveless dress]] (white-black-red) with [[double-breasted|two parallel rows]] of [[buttons]], [[brown belt]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

title: enchantress_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Black Maiden or Hekate.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/2/23/EnchantressPortrait.png] has her hair styled into short, thick twintails, wearing a solely black, frilled gothic lolita outfit. Her familiar, a patchwork teddy bear named Madd, is seen in the background attacking with purple thorned vines.

As a "Hekate":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/8/83/Hecate_Awakening.jpg], her hair is now waist length and her black dress is long enough to reach the floor. Her black stockings are replaced with black kneesocks, and she also wears a headdress with a black rose and gold butterfly decorations, covering her right eye. In the background, Madd sits behind a pile of destroyed dolls.

As a "Neo Enchantress":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/8/8b/Neo-_Enchantress_Artwork.jpg], her hair is almost her whole body in length and styled into curls. Her black dress is adorned by gold bone decorations and her headdress is replaced with a black bonnet. In the background, Madd is seen in a suit and opera mask, looking over a pile of burning dolls and thorns.

title: creator_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. A subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]] that has space-warping powers.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/a/a3/CreatorPortrait1.png] is a messy blonde-haired, blue-eyed young girl with pointy ears. She wears circle frame glasses, a black jacket with yellow stripes, a yellow dress, black shorts and almost knee-high boots. She's often also seen with a small brown bag wrapped across her torso.

Her "second Awakening":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/7/7a/Creator_Awakening.jpg] is almost exactly the same in appearance, save for a few added yellow details to her jacket and wearing black sneakers with knee-high socks. The floating metal lion head behind her is her familiar, an avatar of Cabala, one of the Time Lords.

title: witch_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Trickster or Geniewiz.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/f/f4/WitchPortrait.PNG] features her wearing a red one-piece dress, a black cape, black witch hat, and black shoes with curled ends. Some of her minor familiars are sitting atop of her head and shoulders. A bandage adorns her nose.

As a "Trickster":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/e/ea/New_Geniewiz.png], her hair is styled into twintails and has taken on a slightly pink tinge. Her witch hat is replaced with a comically large one, the top of her one-piece is white, and she now has a bandage on her cheek. She also wears a red capelet, black thighhighs, and carries around a small red bag with random tools and candy in it. Some of her homunculi are seen flying around in the background.

As a "Neo Witch":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/5/5d/Neo-_Witch_Artwork.jpg], she wears a long black and red jacket and her witch hat is of immense proportions. She wears black kneesocks, exposing some of the myriad bandages along her legs.

title: weapon_master_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male slayer (dungeon and fighter)|male Slayer]]. Also known as the Grand Master or Omniblade.

As a "Weapon Master":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/8/81/WeaponMasterPortrait.png], he retains mostly the same look as a Slayer, with the exception of his red arm turning white.

His appearance as an "Omniblade":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/1/1d/SwordGodPortrait.png] swaps his outfit out for a more Eastern-influenced one, with his "Neo Weapon Master":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/d/de/Neo-_Blade_Master_Artwork.jpg] outfit retaining mostly the same look, but with an open jacket and rice hat.

title: asura_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male slayer (dungeon and fighter)|male Slayer]]. Also known as the Silent Eye or Indra.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/7/79/AsuraPortrait.png] is similar to the base male Slayer's, with the exception of a black cape and black blindfold.

As an "Indra":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/8/8d/IndraPortrait.png], he instead takes on a more god-like appearance, having blue skin and a large, spiked halo behind him.

His appearance as a "Neo Asura":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/b/be/Neo-_Asura_Artwork.jpg] further cements his characterization as a god-like being by adding elements of Hindu and Buddhist iconography.

title: ghost_slayer_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body: A [[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character and subclass of the [[male slayer (dungeon and fighter)|Slayer]].

title: soul_bender_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male slayer (dungeon and fighter)|male Slayer]]. Also known as the Soul Reaper or Dark Lord.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/7/71/SoulBenderPortrait.png] is mostly the same, save for a purple aura and yellow runes appearing on his demon arm. He retains this look as a "Dark Lord":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/1/1d/DarkLordPortrait.png], save for the addition of skull-themed armor pieces.

As a "Neo Soul Bender":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/9/94/Neo-_Soul_Bender_Artwork.jpg], he sports predominantly black clothing and a demon-themed visor replaces the Slayer's blue headband.

title: ghostblade_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[male slayer (dungeon and fighter)|male Slayer]]. Also known as the Yaksha or Rakshasa.

Unlike the other four Slayer subclasses, the "Ghostblade":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/3/3c/GhostBladePortrait.png] has a distinctly different appearance from his base class, having long hair, tattered clothing, and a blue demon arm instead of a red one. He is possessed by an unnamed ghostly familiar that aids him in combat, similar in build to the Ghostblade himself with almost the opposite coloration - black hair, coal-like skin, and a tattered maroon hakama.

As a "Rakshasa":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/c/c6/Rakshasa_Awakening.jpg], his hair is spikier and blue crystals have grown on his upper body and demon arm.

As a "Neo Ghostblade":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/1/19/Neo-_Ghostblade.jpg], the duo switches hair and clothing colors.

title: dark_knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. A unique variation of the [[male slayer (dungeon and fighter)|Slayer]] that has time-warping powers.

His "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/0/0e/DarkKnightPortrait1.png] has his white hair parted to the left, with yellow eyes whose sclerae have turned black. He wears a white vest, white pants and white greaves, all lightly decorated with gold diamond patterns. Unlike the Slayer, his demonic arm is black instead of red, with the chains binding it being gold instead of gray.

His "second Awakening":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/0/06/Dark_Knight_Awakening_Fullbody.png] recolors much of his clothing black and gives his skin a slightly purple tinge.

title: buront
body:
Originally from [[2channel]]'s message boards, Buront is the name of a poster whose unusual phrases and brash attitude quickly made him a celebrity. 

A fan of the MMORPG [[Final Fantasy XI]] and the fighting game series [[Guilty Gear]], Buront generally appears in images as an [[Elvaan]] [[Paladin (final fantasy)|]] wielding a Gluttony Sword. His hatred of ninjas is legendary.

His signature attack is "Megaton Punch".

His unusual phrases are well known as "burontism" and someone who uses it is called a "burontist". As common net slang, by 2010, burontism and Buront himself appeared in some games, a cover page of a magazine, and the April Fool's event of an official page.

h4. External links

* "Burontism libraries":http://www.geocities.jp/burontosan/ 
* "Parallel translation of Burontism":http://wiki.livedoor.jp/buront/d/%a5%d6%a5%ed%a5%f3%a5%c8%b3%a4%a4%f2%c5%cf%a4%eb

title: tomato_(sword)
body: [[Koseki Bijou]]'s dark [[katana]], introduced with her [[koseki bijou (casual)|third costume]]. Its blade is made of the same purple gemstone as her [[chest jewel]] (and, this costume [[cracked skin|implies]], the rest of her body under her human-appearing skin), and the guard and pommel are crystals of the same gem. Its name is a play on [[yamato (sword)|Yamato]], [[vergil (devil may cry)|Vergil]]'s sword from the [i][[devil may cry (series)|Devil May Cry]][/i] series, and is pronounced "to-[i]mah[/i]-to".

title: katsudon_(food)
body:
A [[rice bowl]] topped with [[katsu_(food)|]], a deep-fried pork cutlet.

The most common recipe uses a flavoring sauce, onions and beaten eggs. However, there are other variations, including one well-known recipe which uses Worcestershire sauce and shredded cabbage. To differentiate the two, the former is sometimes called "[i]Tamago-toji [bound-together-with-egg] katsudon[/i]," whereas the latter is called "[i]Sauce Katsudon[/i]."

A common trope in Japanese crime dramas is for the detective to eat katsudon while interrogating a suspect. The typical heart-of-gold type detective would think, "if this guy goes to the slammer, he'd never be able to eat anything as good as this again," and then use his own coin to order a katsudon delivered straight to the suspect's house. Then the suspect would be moved so much as to turn himself in and confess to the crime, tears streaming down his face. And so goes the cliche. For these stories, there is an explanation that katsudon was the most expensive food that one could get on a police officer's salary. 

This is nowadays only seen as a joke or stereotype, but Japanese people have come up with the expression, "let someone eat katsudon," which carries the same meaning as "read someone their Miranda rights" (see post #1184509).

h4. Examples

* !post #7933820

h4. See also

* [[katsu (food)|]]
* [[rice bowl]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Katsudon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katsudon
* "The Japan Times: Investigating the linguistic allure of hard-boiled detectives":https://www.japantimes.co.jp/life/2008/06/10/language/investigating-the-linguistic-allure-of-hard-boiled-detectives/

title: myanmar
body: Myanmar, formerly known as Burma, is a country located in Southeast Asia. The official language is Burmese, a Sino-Tibetan language. Its capital is Naypidaw. It shares borders with [[Thailand]], [[India]], [[Bangladesh]], and [[China]].

title: los_angeles_police_department
body:
The Los Angeles Police Department is one of the more well-known police forces in America. Due to serving one of its major cities, their storied history (especially issues with minority communities and their frequent conflicts with inner-city criminal gangs), and proximity to Hollywood, the LAPD has been featured extensively in American pop culture in both straightforward incarnation to satire, from [[Grand Theft Auto]] to [[The Terminator]] to The Closer.

The department is headed by a Chief and operates within the jurisdiction of the City of Los Angeles. Although not the first police department in the United States to have a [[S.W.A.T.]] (Special Weapons and Tactics) team, the establishment of it in 1967 by John Nelson and expansion under the leadership of the controversial Daryl Gates would solidify the unit into public consciousness. 

The department tasked with upholding the law, traffic control, prevention and response to crime, and providing community services. The LAPD is organized into 39 divisions and 10 bureaus to address different aspects of law enforcement.

h4. See also
* [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]]

h4. External Links
* "Official LAPD Website":[https://www.lapdonline.org/]

title: los_angeles
body:
A major city located in Southern [[California]], [[United States]]. It is the largest city in California and the second-largest city in the United States, after [[new york city|New York City]]. Often referred to as L.A., Los Angeles is known for its vibrant culture, diverse population, entertainment industry, and iconic landmarks.

The city of Los Angeles encompasses a vast metropolitan area that stretches across approximately 503 square miles (1,302 square kilometers). It is situated in a coastal basin and is bordered by the Pacific Ocean to the west, the San Gabriel Mountains to the north, and various cities and communities in the surrounding regions.

Los Angeles is renowned for its entertainment industry, particularly Hollywood, which is the center of the American film and television industry. Many major film studios, production companies, and entertainment-related businesses are based in Los Angeles. The city is also known for its thriving music scene, hosting numerous concerts, festivals, and a variety of cultural events.

Los Angeles is also famous for its iconic landmarks, including the Hollywood Sign, the Walk of Fame, Griffith Observatory, Santa Monica Pier, Universal Studios Hollywood, Getty Center, and many others. 

h4. See Also 
* [[Los Angeles Police Department]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Los Angeles":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles]
* "Wikipedia: California":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California]
* "Wikipedia: United States of America":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_of_America]

title: rapunzel's_tangled_adventure
body:
An animated TV series serving as a sequel to the film [[Tangled]], having an overarching story focusing on mysterious unbreakable rocks growing around the kingdom and why [[Rapunzel (disney)|]]'s hair has returned to its previous [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] state and is likewise unbreakable. It was renamed from [b]Tangled: The Series[/b] to [b]Rapunzel's Tangled Adventure[/b] after the first season.

h4. Original characters

* [[Cassandra (tangled)|]]
* [[Varian (tangled)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Rapunzel's Tangled Adventure":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapunzel's_Tangled_Adventure
* "Disney Wiki: Tangled: The Series":https://disney.fandom.com/wiki/Tangled:_The_Series
other_names: ラプンツェルザシリーズ

title: cassandra_(tangled)
body: A character introduced in [[Rapunzel's Tangled Adventure]]. [[Rapunzel (disney)|]]'s head lady-in-waiting and the adopted daughter of the captain of the guards. [spoiler]Eventually revealed to be [[Mother Gothel]]'s abandoned biological daughter. In season 3, she betrays her friends and seizes power of the Moonstone, the counterpart to the Sundrop possessed by Rapunzel, causing her hair to turn [[blue hair|blue]].[/spoiler]
other_names: カサンドラ(ディズニー)

title: pubic_hair
body:
Hair growing in the pubic area, also known as 'pubes'. For pubic hair on males, see [[male pubic hair]]. For pubic hair on females, see [[female pubic hair]].

Visible pubic hair should usually be rated E, or sometimes Q, but rarely S.

When the pubic hair is notably thick or unshaven, [[excessive pubic hair]] is also applicable.

title: soobrazitelny_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Soviet destroyer [i]Soobrazitelny[/i], the second of five [i]Storozhevoy[/i]-class destroyers built for the Black Sea Fleet.

h4. History
Historically ordered as a sister ship of [[Grozny (Azur Lane)|]] and the other [i]Gnevny[/i]-class destroyers, she was reordered to the new [i]Storozhevoy[/i] design, itself the result of [[Hunter (Azur Lane)|]]'s battle damage in the Spanish Civil War reaching Joseph Stalin's war meeting and his request for all destroyers to use alternating boiler and engine rooms for survival.

Commissioned in 1941, she was primarily assigned to shore bombardment and convoy duties. Post-war, she was used as a rescue ship. A 1965 attempt by veterans to have her preserved as a museum ship on account of her battle record was unsuccessful and was sold for scrap afterward.

h4. Skins

title: g36_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Bundeswehr's standard infantry rifle, the [[H&K G36]], in [[Girls' Frontline]].

One of the few T-Dolls that frequently receives new art from their artist, [[Imoko (imonatsuki)|]]. 

Would receive a [[G36 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. title: hk416_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K HK416]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|grey]], [[aqua hair|aqua]], or [[white hair]], [[green eyes]], and wears a black [[beret]], [[military jacket]], [[plaid skirt]], and [[black thighhighs]].

Based on her in-game lines she seems to hold her skills as a soldier in high regard and strives to outperform the AR Team, especially [[M16A1 (girls' frontline)|]]. She also shows some [[yandere]] qualities towards the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]].

A member of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]] along with [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]], [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]] and [[G11 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[HK416 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], she appears as [[Clukay (neural cloud)|]]. In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], she appears as [[Klukai (girls' frontline 2)|]].

Voiced by [[Nonaka Ai]]. Illustrated by [[Gyaku Tsubasa]], though for Herbal-Flavored Hard Candy and Percussion Bolero, she was illustrated by [[Starshadowmagician]] and [[han-0v0]] respectively.

title: springfield_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[M1903 Springfield]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with the [[sidelocks]] done in [[hair rings]] and the remainder in a [[ponytail]]. She has [[green eyes]], wears a blue [[blazer]] with a white sash and a [[white dress]]. Since the M1903 was developed in America and largely put into service during World War I, she is often depicted with the [[American flag]].

She's typically depicted as as having a housewife-esque attitude, preparing coffee for the Commander (running the base's café), making handmade chocolate during Valentines and baking muffins to eat together with the player/Commander. Appears in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]] as [[springfield (girls' frontline 2)|herself]].

She is voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

title: ksvk_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[KSVK 12.7]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

KSVK is [[DP-12 (girls' frontline)|]]'s adoptive daughter. Initially this was only according to their artist [[Pandea Work]], but was made canon in KSVK's [[KSVK (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]] story, itself an adapted version of Pandea's original concept for their shared backstory. Prior to becoming KSVK, she was known as Dushevnaya (originally Duševnyj), which is the name she also bears in [[Dushevnaya (neural cloud)|her appearance]] in the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], and [[dushevnaya (girls' frontline 2)|her appearance]] in the sequel, [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium|Exilium]].

title: wattson_(apex_legends)
body:
Wattson is a playable Legend in [[Apex Legends]], added to the game in season 2.

Wattson has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her most distinctive feature is a [[burn scar]] on her left cheek in the shape of a [[Lichtenberg figure]]. Her default costume consists of a [[hooded bodysuit|hooded]] [[blue bodysuit|blue]] [[ribbed bodysuit]] worn under a [[white bodysuit]] with [[cable]]s and an [[orange jacket|orange]] [[hooded jacket]] with a [[lightning bolt symbol]] on the upper arm. She also wears [[blue gloves]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]].

She is often pictured wielding an [[L-STAR]], as the weapon was added to the game at the same time as her, and her heirloom weapon is the [[Energy Reader (apex legends)|]]. She has a pet [[cat]] named [[Nikola (apex legends)|]], and is notably fond of [[Nessie (respawn)|]] - to the point that she's credited as the person responsible for the plushies hidden around the various maps.

Wattson is voiced by "Justine Huxley":[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0404722/] in English and "Kondou Yui":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%BF%91%E8%97%A4%E5%94%AF#%E3%82%B2%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0] in Japanese.

title: nagone_mako
body:
An [[utau|UTAUloid]]. Her voice comes from an amateur singer on NicoNico named "たぬＱ" (TANU Q). When drawn she is known to have dark hair that is in a [[ponytail]].

She does not have an "official" outfit. Fans have been known to change her outfit for almost every video- although the underlining "shinobi" feel is a consistency with all of her appearances.

In some uploads and images, she is seen playing a violin. The genderbent version of Mako is (和音マコト Nagone Makoto).

title: asuka_(senran_kagura)
body:
[[Senran Kagura]] main character. A second-year Shinobi student and leader at the Hanzou Academy.

Asuka has [[black hair]], usually tied into a medium length [[ponytail]] with a [[white ribbon]]. When she transforms into a shinobi, she wears a yellow [[vest]] over a [[white shirt]] and [[green necktie]]. With it she wears a [[green dress|green]] [[plaid dress]] and a [[red scarf]]. She wears red arm guards over [[bandages]], and [[thighhighs]] with [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. She is usually seen with her twin [[sword]]s.

Asuka's favorite food is futomaki rolls. She fights for justice and wants to follow in the footsteps of her grandfather Hanzou, a legendary shinobi of his time. Sheer willpower and determination is what drives her to master the way of the shinobi. Firm believer that the Sword and Shield's true power comes from using both. Her guardian animal is the toad. 

When her clothes are ripped off, she is revealed to be wearing a simple [[striped bikini]].

Her seiyuu is [[Harada Hitomi]].

h4. External links

* "Kagurapedia: Asuka":https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Asuka
* "MyAnimeList: Asuka":https://myanimelist.net/character/67531/Asuka

title: blade_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Called [i]Ren[/i] in Chinese and [i]Jin[/i] in Japanese. 

A member of the Stellaron Hunters, and a swordsman [spoilers]who abandoned his body to become a blade[/spoilers]. He pledges loyalty to Destiny's Slave, and possesses a terrifying self-healing ability.

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] dark [[blue hair|blue]]/[[black hair]] with a [[red hair|red]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], and [[red eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[brown shirt]] worn with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black jacket]], [[black belt]], [[grey pants]], multiple [[bandages]] on different parts of his body, [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on his right hand, and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. Voiced by [[Miki Shin'ichirou]] (JP) and [[Daman Mills]] (EN).

h4. Profile
[expand]
A member of the Stellaron Hunters, whose real name is unknown. Blade wields an ancient sword that has filled with cracks, just like his body and his mind.
[/expand]

title: huohuo_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

A trainee Ten-Lords Commission Judge of the Xianzhou Luofu, she is a young [[fox girl|Foxian girl]] possessed by a [[Tail (Honkai: Star Rail)|heliobus]]. She is a timid and weak girl who is afraid of all kinds of strange things, but is responsible for luring and subduing evil spirits. Voiced by [[Naganawa Maria]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and [[green eyes]] with [[paw-shaped pupils]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[dianzi]], [[green dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[brown belt]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks]], and dark [[blue footwear|blue shoes]]. She also normally carries an improvised white [[flag]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7691346: Splash art
* !post #8768426: Night of Fright (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
A pitiable and helpless Foxian girl who is also a Ten-Lords Commission Judge-in-training, who fears ghosts but must catch them.

Due to having a heliobus named Tail sealed in her tail by the judges of the Ten-Lords Commission, she became a "cursed one" who attracts inhuman beings.

She fears demons and heliobi, but contrarily is tasked with their capture and entrusted with the heavy task of eradicating vile spirits.
Though she believes herself lacking in ability, she is unable to muster the courage to resign and continues onward despite walking in a valley of her own fear.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] light [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[skin tight]] [[purple dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], and a purple [[veil]].

title: fu_xuan_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

She is the head of the Xianzhou Luofu's Divination Commission. She manages the Xianzhou Luofu's route by calculating it and predicts the fortune of future events. Voiced by [[Itou Miku]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[small breasts]], and a [[forehead jewel]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[layered dress]] ([[black dress|black]] outer and purple-[[pink dress|pink]] inner), [[white pantyhose]], [[vambraces]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[pumps]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7690465: Splash art
* !post #8768517: She Already Shut Her Eyes (Signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
The head of the Xianzhou Luofu's Divination Commission. A confident and blunt sage.

Using her third eye and the Matrix of Prescience, Fu Xuan calculates the Xianzhou's route and predicts the fortune of future events. She firmly believes that everything she does is the "best solution" for the situation.

Fu Xuan is waiting for the general's promised "abdication." However, that day still seems... very far away.
[/expand]

title: himeko_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Tanaka Rie]] in Japanese. 

An adventurous scientist who encountered and repaired a stranded train as a child. She now ventures across the universe with her train currently named the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]], operating as its navigator. 

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[red hair]], and [[large breasts]] with a [[mole_on_breast|mole on her right breast]]. She typically wears a [[white dress]] that shows off her [[cleavage]], [[black coat]] with the Nameless' badge on the right side, [[black gloves]], and [[black_footwear|black]] [[pumps]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #4830059: Splash art
* !post #8768421: Night on the Milky Way (Signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
An adventurous scientist who encountered the Astral Express as a child when it got stranded in her home world.

At that time, some existence in the Express revealed to this young girl a whole world outside of her own — the universe.

Years later, Himeko finally repaired the train and began her journey to the stars, but she realized that this was only the beginning. On the Trailblaze path, she would need many more companions...

Even though such companions may have different destinations in mind, they all gaze at the same starry sky.
[/expand]


h4. See also
* [[Murata Himeko]] - her [[Benghuai Xueyuan]] and [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.

title: seele_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Nakahara Mai]] (JP) and [[Molly Zhang]] (EN).  

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[purple eyes]] that turn [[red eyes|red]] upon using her ultimate, and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a purple [[detached collar]], [[black bra]] top, [[white leotard]], purple [[detached sleeves]] with a [[red armband]] to her left side, [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on her right hand, and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She uses a [[scythe]] as her main weapon. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7689970: Splash art
* !post #8768327: In the Night (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
A spirited and valiant member of Wildfire who grew up in the perilous Underworld of Belobog. She is accustomed to being on her own.

As someone who once relied on others for protection, she now pursues strength. For the truth of the underground and her family's name, Seele can endure any kind of adversity.

The protectors and the protected, the oppressors and the oppressed... The world Seele grew up knowing was just a simple dichotomy...

That is, until "that girl" appeared.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Seele Vollerei]] - her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]/[[Benghuai Xueyuan]] counterpart.
** Specifically, she combines the color scheme of HI3 Seele's [[Seele Vollerei (Swallowtail Phantasm)|Swallowtail Phantasm]] form with the red eyes of [[Seele (Alter Ego)|the Alter Ego]] form.

title: bailu_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Katou Emiri]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] with [[antenna hair|two ahoge]] and tied into [[twin braids]], [[green eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[dragon horns]] and [[dragon tail|tail]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress]] worn under a [[white coat|white]] [[wave print]] [[duijin ruqun]] with [[detached sleeves]] and [[fur trim]], a [[gourd]] to her left, [[blue socks]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

Her race is the [[dragon girl|Vidyadhara]], and serves as its current High Elder. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #7691280: Splash art
* !post #8768102: Time Waits for No One (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
A vivacious young lady of the Vidyadhara race, she is known as the "Healer Lady" due to her expertise with medicine.

She often dishes out unorthodox prescriptions such as "Stay well hydrated" and "Get a good night's rest."

Bailu cannot bear to see people suffer, and that's why you'll see her with her eyes shut tightly as she cures ailments.

"As long as they're cured, that's all that matters, right?"
[/expand]

h4. See also
* [[Baiheng (honkai: star rail)|]]

title: wing_gundam_zero_custom
body:
The XXXG-00W0 Wing Gundam Zero Custom is the mobile suit featured in the [[gundam wing: endless waltz|film version]] of [[gundam_wing|Mobile Suit Gundam Wing]].

It is a highly redesigned unit by [[Katoki Hajime]], and can easily be distinguished from the original [[Wing Gundam Zero]] (designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]]) or the Proto Zero (also designed by Katoki) by having 4 large, angel-like [[wings]], a redesigned Twin [[Buster Rifle]] (which is now also longer in this version), and the absence of a shield and transformation system (although [i]The Glory of Losers[/i] manga, the Hi-Res Model, and the Master Grade Ver.Ka [[GunPla]] kit brought back the shield and transformation system).
other_names: ウイングガンダムゼロカスタム

title: after_war_gundam_x
body:
[b]After War Gundam X[/b] is the third [[alternate universe]] series in the [[Gundam]] franchise. It features an alternate outcome to the One Year War in the original series (Universal Century 0079) and ran for 39 episodes.

For the mobile suit, see [[gundam_x|Gundam X]].

title: gundam_x
body:
[b]GX-9900 Gundam X[/b]

A powerful [[Mobile Suit]] developed by the Earth Alliance to fight the Spacenoids' looming threat of colony drops. Equipped with the massively powerful [[Satellite Cannon]], it could wipe out a colony with one shot. While most of them were destroyed in the war, one surviving unit made its way into the hands of everyman [[Garrod Ran]], who wielded its terrifying power to protect his "mission target" - the cute but enigmatic [[Tiffa Adill]].

title: shining_finger
body:
[i]This hand of mine glows with an awesome power. 
Its burning grip tells me to defeat you!
Take this! My love, my anger, and all of my sorrow!
[b]SHINING FINGER! GO! GO! GO![/b][/i]

--[[Domon Kasshu]], [i][[G Gundam|Mobile Fighter G Gundam]][/i]

A special move used by [[Domon Kasshu]]'s [[Shining Gundam]] in [[G Gundam]]. It envelops the right or left hand with glowing, hot energy and is then used to crush an enemy Gundam's head. 

There are two other variants of the move: [[Master Gundam]]'s ([[Master Asia]]) Darkness Finger and [[God Gundam]]'s (Domon Kasshu) [[Bakunetsu God Finger]]. [[Turn X]] ([[Gym Ghingnham]], [i][[Turn A Gundam]][/i]) also uses a version of the Shining Finger.

[[Destiny Gundam]]'s ([[Shinn Asuka]], [i][[Gundam SEED Destiny]][/i]) Palma Fiocina and [[Guren Mk-ii]]'s ([[Kouzuki Kallen]], [i][[Code Geass]][/i]) Fukushahadou are similar, but not exactly the same as the Shining Finger. Do not use this tag with these two [[mecha]] unless it's a direct imitation or parody.

Use this tag for all variants of the move being used, and (for [[parody]] purposes) if the character's hand appears to be "glowing with an awesome power" or "burning red".
other_names: シャイニングフィンガー

title: bakunetsu_god_finger
body:
The [[God Gundam]]'s finishing move, essentially a more powerful version of the [[Shining Finger]]. 

Like the Shining Finger, the Bakunetsu God Finger also envelopes the right or left hand with glowing, hot energy. One difference is that while the former targets an opponent Gundam's head, the latter targets the midsection instead, which is then followed by the [i]Heat End[/i] maneuver, where the God Gundam discharges all of its energy at once while its hand is still plunged into an opponent's body, destroying it from the inside out.

It is renamed to [b]Erupting Burning Finger[/b] in the English dub.
other_names: 爆熱ゴッドフィンガー

title: mongolian_clothes
body:
Traditional and contemporary clothes worn by mongolians. 

H4. Clothing
