title: zaku_iii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]AMX-011 Zaku III[/b]

This cutting edge [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]] is a [[Zaku]] in name only - with outrageously improved all-round aspects, most notably [i]four times the thruster acceleration of the [[Zaku II]],[/i] and loaded with beam weapons all around, it's far from the average grunt suit its predecessor was. One unit was famously piloted by [[Rakan Dahkaran]] before he defected to [[Glemy Toto]]'s faction, and a number of those found themselves in the hands of the "Sleeves" during [[gundam_unicorn|UC 0096]].

Succeeded by the [[Zaku IV]].

h4. See also
* [[Zaku III Custom]]

title: deel
body: A deel is a traditional [[mongolian clothes|mongolian]] coat/dress worn by Mongolian and Turkic people. Its is long, usually reaching below the knees and with long sleeves. It is similar in its side buttoning to [[china dress|qipao]], but can also have a [[fold-over collar]].

title: hayato_kobayashi
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series from 1979.

[b]Hayato Kobayashi[/b] is the young [[Japan]]ese pilot of the [[Guntank]] [[mobile suit]] during The One Year War. He also appears later in [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]], where he is now a high ranking [[aeug|Karaba]] officer. 

[spoilers]After the events of the original Gundam, Hayato married [[Fraw Bow]] who became pregnant with his child, and adopted orphans [[Katz Kobayashi]], [[Letz Cofan]], and [[Kikka Kitamoto]]. In Gundam ZZ Hayato dies during the First Neo Zeon War while piloting a [[Dodai Kai]] in [[battle]] against [[Rakan Dahkaran]] (who used a [[Zaku III]]) at the destroyed city of Dublin while defending refugees from a [[Colony Drop]] attack by [[Neo Zeon]].[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Mobile Suit Guntank]]

title: paolo_cassius
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979 and also appears in the last episode of the [[Mobile Suit Gundam The Origin]] OVA released in 2018.

[b]Paolo Cassius[/b] is the original veteran captain of the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [[White Base]] [[mobile suit]] space carrier. [spoilers]He is gravely wounded during a [[Zeon]] attack early in the series, so he relegates command of the ship to novice officer [[Bright Noa]].[/spoilers]

title: hyaku_shiki
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]MSN-00100 Hyaku Shiki (Type 100)[/b]

A high-performance [[mobile suit]] that serves as [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s final main personal unit in [[Zeta Gundam]]. Armaments include a [[beam rifle]], clay [[bazooka_(gundam)|bazooka]], and a pair of [[energy sword|beam sabers]]. It has a trademark golden color due to its experimental special and advanced anti-beam coating. The mecha can also use the [[beam_cannon|mega bazooka launcher]].

It is the actual final and definitive version of the MSN-001 [[Delta Gundam]], a prototype transformable Mobile Suit that was scrapped in the planning stages and later changed into a high-performance mobile suit. Vestiges of this can be seen in the flexible binders behind the Hyaku Shiki. 

[spoilers]The Hyaku was severely [[damaged]] in [[battle]] during the final [[duel]] of [[Haman Karn]] (in her [[Qubeley]]) and Quattro Bajeena. Apparently destroyed after Haman defeats Quattro, its [[wreckage]] is later shown floating in space (with its cockpit hatch open), implying Quattro's survival of the encounter. The repaired MS later appears in [[Gundam ZZ]] as part of the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i] where it is operated mostly by [[Beecha Oleg]][/spoilers]

h4. Related development
* [[Zero Shiki (Gundam)]]

title: peter_maximoff
body:
The [[Quicksilver]] of the Fox Studios [i][[X-Men]][/i] movie franchise. Unlike his comic book counterpart [[Pietro Maximoff]], he's born and raised in the United States and is a bit older than the mainstream X-Men team chronologically. 

Has a younger sister, but it's unclear if she is their universe's [[Wanda Maximoff|Wanda]] or not.

title: doctor_strange
body: Dr. Stephen Vincent Strange is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by Steve Ditko, the character first appeared in Strange Tales #110 (cover-dated July 1963). Doctor Strange serves as the Sorcerer Supreme, the primary protector of Earth against magical and mystical threats. Strange was introduced during the Silver Age of Comic Books in an attempt to bring a different kind of character and themes of mysticism to Marvel Comics.
other_names: ドクター・ストレンジ
スティーヴン・ストレンジ

title: doctor_fate
body: Doctor Fate (also known as Fate) is the name of several superheroes appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. The first version was originally created by writer Gardner Fox and artist Howard Sherman, debuting in More Fun Comics #55 (May 1940). Eight characters have served as incarnations of the character within the mainstream DC Universe, with each new version after the original attempting to reinvigorate the character for contemporary audiences.

title: they_(zelda)
body: An enigmatic alien-like enemy in [[The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask]]. Resembling traditional depictions of the [[Flatwoods Monster]], they appear at night to abduct the cows of Romani Ranch. If [[Link]] fails to defeat them, they will also end up abducting [[Romani (Zelda)|Romani]]. She ends up being sent back the following day in a catatonic state.

title: moaning
body: A long, low sound expressing physical or mental suffering or sexual pleasure. Tagged when it appears someone is moaning (aided by [[sound effects]] in the art, or even [[sound|hearing it audibly]]).

title: murmansk_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Omaha[/i]-class light cruiser [i]Murmansk[/i], formerly USS [i]Milwaukee[/i] (CL-5).

She has [[long hair|long]] platinum [[blonde hair]], [[heterochromia]] ([[blue eyes|blue on her left]] and [[purple eyes|purple on her right]]), and [[medium breasts|an ample chest]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[winter clothes|winter style]] [[fur-trimmed dress]], [[white coat|white]] [[winter coat]] with fur trim, [[papakha]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of all 8 single 152 mm single mounts and 2 152 mm twin mounts, an [[anchor]] to a [[chain]], and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]]. 

Character designed by [[Byulzzi]] and voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]].

title: mainz_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German light cruiser [i]Mainz[/i], as part of a collaboration with [[World of Warships]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is a white [[military uniform]] comprising a [[white jacket]] with [[juliet sleeves]], [[black belt]], [[black gloves]], [[Iron Cross]] ornaments on her cuffs and red straps, cross [[earrings]], [[black hairband]], [[black cape]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], black [[garter straps]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her four intended 150 mm triple gun mounts on individual animal head pieces, while she uses a [[rapier]] as her melee weapon.

Character design by [[Liduke]], voiced by [[Kaida Yuuko]].

In her normal [[military uniform|uniform]], Trieste wears an oversized [[black coat]] with [[epaulettes]] and [[aiguillette]], [[black jacket]] that [[sideboob|shows]] her [[large breasts|sizable]] bosom with a [[mole on breast|mole]] near one of her breasts.  [[miniskirt|short]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[black skirt]] over [[black pantyhose]]. She also has [[white gloves]], a [[sheathed]] European [[sword]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

title: shiratsuyu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the lead and name ship of the Shiratsuyu-class destroyers, IJN [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]. 

She has [[short hair|short]], [[brown hair]] tied up into a [[two side up]] with white ribbons, [[green eyes]], white [[dog ears]], and a fluffy, white [[dog tail]]. Her uniform consists of a slightly modified black and white [[serafuku]]. Her top is a white [[crop top]] with [[long sleeves]] that extend [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]]. Her skirt is a normal [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]. She wears [[white legwear|white]] [[kneehighs]] that lead into high-heeled [[mary janes]] that have a ship-motif, with a red-black color scheme and propeller.

title: repulse_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of HMS [i]Repulse[/i].

She has [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of with a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], a white [[capelet]], [[white_legwear|white]] [[thighhighs]], and a [[crop top]] that leaves her with an exposed [[midriff]]. 

She is one of three ships the player starts the game with, alongside the player's selected starter ship and [[Long Island (Azur Lane)|]]. Her skill activation phrase, "Neratte Pon~," is well known for this reason.

Historically, HMS [i]Repulse[/i] was completed shortly after the Battle of Jutland, but had a fairly unremarkable history until the outbreak of the Second World War. In November 1941 the Royal Navy sent her and [[Prince of Wales (Azur Lane)|Prince of Wales]], alongside other vessels, to reinforce Singapore against Japanese attack. After the Attack on Pearl Harbor, the two were famously sunk by a large air attack by Japanese bombers, their air defences insufficient to stave off the assault.

h4. Skins

* !post #8753510: [[repulse (dance of spring blooms) (azur lane)|Dance of Spring Blooms]]

title: coral_(fate)
body: A minor character appearing in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A Wind Clan fairy, and [[aurora_(fate)|Aurora]]'s top aide. She acts haughty and speaks down to humans, but has a hidden soft spot for them. [spoiler]Near the conclusion of the chapter, she is callously murdered by Aurora after objecting to her plan to throw away the lives of her human soldiers to hold off the Mors.[/spoiler]

title: mike_(fate)
body: A minor character appearing in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. An Earth Clan fairy who runs an inn and pub, but doesn't really understand how they are supposed to work because he has never interacted with humans. He becomes infatuated with [[leonardo_da_vinci_(rider)_(fate)| Da Vinci]] as she teaches him how to run an inn properly. [spoiler]At the conclusion of the chapter, the Mors corruption begins to drive Mike insane and almost causes him to murder Da Vinci, but in the end his feelings win out and he sees her off with a smile as the Lostbelt fades away.[/spoiler]

title: chevrolet_corvette
body:
A [[sports car]] produced by the [[Chevrolet]] division of General Motors. Often called 'America's sports car', it is currently in its eight generation as of 2020.

The Corvette is heavily associated with the [[Barbie (franchise)|]] franchise, with [[Barbie (character)|]]'s official car being a pink Corvette since the 70s. The generation sold in merchandise usually corresponds to the contemporary production model, though the [[barbie (live action)|2023 film]] features a C1.

title: ector_(fate)
body:
A minor character appearing in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. An Earth Clan fairy who worked as a blacksmith on the outskirts of Tintagel, he became a paternal figure to [[artoria_caster_(fate)|Artoria Caster]]. [spoiler]When [[morgan_le_fay_(fate)|High Queen Morgan]] sent an army to raze the village and murder the Child of Prophecy, Ector sacrificed himself to help Artoria escape.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]In the distant past of the Lostbelt, he was also known as The Black Knight, and was one of [[aesc_(fate)|Aesc the Savior]]'s traveling companions.[/spoiler]

title: latias
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #380 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Dragon/Psychic Legendary Pokémon. 

Latias is a bird-like, dragon Pokémon. It has an aerodynamic body and glass-like down feathers. The lower half of its body is red with jet-plane wings and fin-like feet. It is always female and the counterpart of [[Latios]].

It can [[mega pokemon|mega evolve]] into [[Mega Latias]] with a [i]Latiasite[/i].

Prior Pokémon: [[Registeel]]
Next Pokémon: [[Latios]]

h4. See also

* [[Latias (Human) (pokemon adventures)|]] ([[Pokemon Adventures]])

title: kimi_to_semi_blue_(idolmaster)
body:
A song and set of [[official alternate costume|costume]]s from [[Gakuen Idolmaster]]. The group version is performed by [[Shiun Sumika]], [[Himesaki Rinami]], and [[Arimura Mao]].

Most of the idols have a variation of Mao's costume as an alternate for their debut SSRs.

title: kagamine_rin_(future_style)
body:
A [[list_of_project_diva_modules|module]] for [[Kagamine Rin]] in the [[Project Diva (series)|]] games that makes her appear [[aged up|older]], by giving her [[very long hair]], and a change in outfit of from wearing shorts to a skirt to make her outfit design to look more like [[Hatsune Miku]]'s.

It is also common for artists to give Rin medium or large breasts in her future style, instead of Rin’s usual small or flat chest.

The original design for Furture Style was made by illustator and PV producer; [[Tamura Hiro]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Project Diva modules]]

title: kagamine_rin_(ame)
body:
A [[list_of_project_diva_modules|module]] for [[Kagamine Rin]] in the  [[project_diva_(series)|Project Diva]] game series. This module is associated with the song [[kagamine_hachi-hachi_hana_no_kassen_(vocaloid)|Kagamine HachiHachi Flower Fight]] by by Moja-P (music) and Niregiru (lyrics).

It consists of a [[blue_jacket|blue]] [[happi]] with [[gold_trim|gold trimmings]] and [[wheat print]] designs, held with a [[red_sash|red]] [[obi|sash]]. The left side of the happi is [[open_clothes|left loose]], exposing a [[sarashi]], as well some [[flower tattoo]] on Rin's [[breast_tattoo|chest]] and [[shoulder_tattoo|left arm]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Project Diva modules]]

title: hope_(fate)
body: A minor character appearing in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A fairy who lost her purpose and her name, slowly transforming into a Mors. She retrieved Ritsuka, [[Tristan (fate)|]], and [[Artoria Caster (Fate)|"Mash"]] from the Forest of Cornwall and took care of them during their stay there. [spoiler]It's revealed that she became the light guiding Artoria Caster during her life after being given Artoria's name in the forest, and that her original name was Hope.[/spoiler]

title: bodysuit
body:
A [[skin tight]], one-piece garment that covers the body from the neck to at least the upper legs.

Note that it has to be one piece of clothing, not separate pieces of clothing, such as a [[leotard]] over a pair of [[pantyhose]].

If it covers only the upper body and not the legs, like a one-piece swimsuit, use [[leotard]] instead. If the fabric is obviously sheer or thin, use [[bodystocking]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #321303
* !post #2340198

h4. Non-examples

* !post #2559755: [[Leotard]]
* !post #1829945: [[Chaps]] plus [[panties]]
* !post #2027696: [[Revealing clothes]]
* !post #2073512: Separated into the top and [[bike shorts]]

h4. Related tags

h6. Types

title: fishnets
body:
A material with an open, diamond shaped knit. It's most often used as a material for stockings, tights or bodystockings and is usually black. Ironically unsuited for catching fish.

Do not confuse with [[fishing net]].

h4. See also

* [[fishnet bodystocking]]
* [[fishnet legwear]]

title: fishnet_leotard
body:
A [[leotard]] fully or partially made out of [[fishnets]].
If the leotard does cover at least the upper legs, do not use this tag. Use [[fishnet bodystocking]] instead.

title: fishnet_bodystocking
body:
A [[bodystocking]] made out of [[fishnets]]. If there is nothing beneath the fishnets, then the characters skin will be fully visible.

h4. See also

* [[fishnet leotard]]

title: mononoke
body:
Occult detective TV series, spin-off from [[Ayakashi: Japanese Classic Horror]].

It follows [[Kusuriuri_(mononoke)|]] from the Ayakashi Bakeneko arc as he travels and eliminates different mononoke by solving the cases which has leaded to their creation and cutting them with his [[sword of exorcism]].

title: faerie_knights_(fate)
body:
Knights who serve Queen [[Morgan le Fay (fate)|]] in the [[avalon le fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]]. They have been granted the True Names of [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]] from proper history, giving them special abilities. This tag applies if [b]all three[/b] are present in an image. [spoiler]They are also known as the [b]Calamity Trio[/b] due to their connections with the three calamities.[/spoiler]
* [[Barghest (fate)|Faerie Knight Gawain]]
* [[Baobhan Sith (fate)|Faerie Knight Tristan]]
* [[Melusine (fate)|Faerie Knight Lancelot]]
While she never appeared in the Lostbelt, [[Britomart (fate)|]] was considered a Faerie Knight after the Chaldea Faerie Knight Cup event.

This tag can also be used for the prior generation of knights that served [[Aesc (fate)|]] if at least three are present.
* [[Mash Kyrielight|Faerie Knight Galahad]]
* [[Habetrot (fate)|Faerie Knight Totorot]]
* [[Ector (fate)|Black Knight]]
* [[Setanta (fate)|Grimr]]
* [[Wryneck (fate)|]]

title: shimakaze_(kancolle)
body:
[b]Shimakaze[/b] (島風, lit. "Island Wind") is the personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shimakaze[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

Shimakaze has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. She wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[serafuku]], [[striped thighhighs]], [[white_gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], a short [[miniskirt]] with [[black_panties|black]] [[highleg panties]] which show off her [[ass]], and a [[black hairband]] with long floppy "ears". She has small robot familiars called [[Rensouhou-chan]]s which represent her three twin "12.7 cm/50 naval gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/12.7_cm/50_Type_3_naval_gun turrets.

h4. Personality and trivia
As she is based on an experimental destroyer built around speed and heavy torpedo armaments, Shimakaze sports a boastful personality, occasionally bragging about how fast she is and nitpick on how "slow" those around her are. In spite of this, due to the historical counterpart only experienced few combat actions (being mostly used as an escort), Shimakaze also have a lazy, "spoiled brat" altitude, being generally carefree and minding her own business rather than the others.

While the historical ship is the fastest bluewater ship in the IJN fleet, she is not the fastest destroyer in the game after the inclusion of [[Tashkent (kancolle)|]] around 2018. After this, Shimakaze is often depicted in fan works as either losing her confidence or viewed Tashkent as a rival she swears to surpass.

Due to her distinctive and revealing outfit, she has become one of the most popular characters of the series, with several artists often drawing the other characters [[cosplay]] [[shimakaze (kancolle) (cosplay)|as her]]. She is also frequently portrayed as an [[otoko no ko]] ([[Shimakaze-kun]]) or as an unrelated boy [[crossdressing]] as her.

Her fan nickname is [i]Zekamashi[/i], Shimakaze spelled backwards due to pre-1946 Japanese orthography reading horizontal writing right-to-left, after it was written on an [[innertube]] on a Rensouhou-chan.

Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #1506257
* !post #3022290: [[shimakaze_(final_battle)_(kancolle)|Final Battle]]
* !post #6187654: [[shimakaze_(anniversary)_(kancolle)|Anniversary]]

h4. See also

* [[Rensouhou-chan]]
* [[Shimakaze-kun]]
* [[Shimakaze (destroyer)]]
* [[Shimakaze (seal)]]
* [[Shimakaze (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Shimakaze (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links

* "Kancolle Wiki: Shimakaze":http://en.kancollewiki.net/Shimakaze
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Shimakaze (Kantai Collection)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/島風(艦隊これくしょん)]
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Shimakaze[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Shimakaze_(1942)]
other_names: 島風(艦隊これくしょん)

title: shimakaze-kun
body:
An unofficial male version of [[Shimakaze (kancolle)|]] of [[Kantai Collection]].

Due to the revealing nature of the original's clothes, Shimakaze-kun will often be an identical-looking [[otoko no ko]].

Depending on context, Shimakaze-kun can be tagged two different ways:
* Usually, Shimakaze-kun is a male [[cosplay|cosplaying]] as Shimakaze. The context is the "real world", where Shimakaze is a memetic character from an online game and media franchise.  This should be tagged [[shimakaze (kancolle) (cosplay)]].
* Less commonly, he may be the actual Shimakaze but male. It may be an alternate reality where Shimakaze was always male, or Shimakaze may have been transformed into a male by some event. The context is the world of Kantai Collection, where Shimakaze is a real person. This should be tagged [[genderswap (ftm)]].

Where insufficient context exists, tagging is up to user discretion, but be consistent. In particular, the first case implies the character is "not really" Shimakaze, while the second implies the character "really" is. Thus they are generally mutually exclusive.

title: prince_hongzhou
body:
[b]Hongzhou[/b] (Chinese:弘昼, Manchurian Script: ᡥᡠᠩᠵᡝᠣ) (5 January 1712 – 2 September 1770), formally known as Prince He, was a Manchu prince of the [[Qing dynasty]]. 

Unlike his brothers Hongli and Hongshi, Hongzhou chose to avoid being involved in rivalry over the succession to their father's throne. He was known to have pretended to be crazy and feminine.

title: bolzano_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Italian heavy cruiser [i]Bolzano[/i]. Character design by [[Haori Io]], voiced by Maekawa Ryouko. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied to a [[single braid]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress]] with a white breast side, armor pieces on her waists, [[white hat|white]] [[peaked cap]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[two-sided fabric|two-tone]] coat ([[white coat|white]] outer with [[epaulettes]], [[green coat|green]] inner), [[mismatched legwear|mismatched thighhighs]] ([[white thighhighs|white]] on her left, [[black thighhighs|black]] on her right), black [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] (with a single [[gauntlets|gauntlet]] on her right), and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces, each containing two 20.3 cm twin gun mounts, a 10 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount, a mast, and a gunnery director.

h4. Skins

* !post #5674571: Default
* !post #5543724: [[bolzano_(a_flutter_in_the_moment)_(azur_lane)|A Flutter in the Moment]] - dancer
* !post #5922609: [[bolzano_(tempting_treasure)_(azur_lane)|Tempting Treasure]] - swimsuit

h5. Alternative versions
* !post #8753495: [[bolzano_(meta)_(azur_lane)|META]]

h4. Related characters
* [[Trento (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Trieste (Azur Lane)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: [i]Bolzano[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_cruiser_Bolzano]

title: tri-brigade_shuraig_the_ominous_omen
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] that has a single [[mechanical wings|mechanical wing]] and a singe [[feathered wings|feathered wing]] and is in [[full armor]] for the official art but is often unmasked in fanart. He leads the Tri-Brigade tribe with [[tri-brigade rugal the silver sheller|Rugal]] and [[tri-brigade_ferrijit_the_barren_blossom|Ferrijit]]. Later upgrades to [[Tri-Brigade Arms Bucephalus II]] with [[Kitt_(yu-gi-oh!)|]]'s help.

h4. External links

* "Character Sheet":https://twitter.com/YuGiOh_OCG_INFO/status/1283733120521396224

title: x_x
body:
Both eyes in the shape of a literal X, to show that a character is comically dead, knocked out or just tired.

See [[x-shaped pupils]] for when only the pupils inside the eyes are shaped like X's. This is for when the entire eye is shaped like an X.

h4. Examples

* !post #7489172
* !post #3087779

h4. See also

* [[>_<]]
* [[x-shaped pupils]]

A standalone question mark in the image, either inside or outside a [[speech bubble]]. Usually denotes wonder, [[confused|confusion]], or curiosity.

This should not be used for question marks that are part of an ordinary sentence.

title: sakamata_chloe_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakamata Chloe]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/i/status/1466362043166965762].

It consists of an [[orca hood]] [[black collar|black]] [[animal collar]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black jacket|black]] [[two-sided jacket|two-sided]]  [[off-shoulder jacket]] held with a [[chest belt]], a [[white camisole|white]] [[frilled camisole]], black [[arm strap]]s, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[multiple belts]] [[black belt]]s including a [[studded belt]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] [[black thighhighs|black]] [[o-ring legwear|o-ring]] thighhighs with [[black garter straps]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[lace-up boots]] with [[colored shoe soles|colored]] [[platform heels|platform]] [[high heel boots|high heels]]. She also has an optional [[eye mask]] and has several small [[caution tape]] decorations on her jacket and thighhighs.

h4. Appearance

title: jiangyu_(neural_cloud)
body:
An Agent in [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]]. A Performer Doll developed by Cyber Media, a past instance of [[Type 97 (girls' frontline)|]] and sister of [[Daiyan (Neural Cloud)|]].

Jiangyu has very [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] in [[twintails]] and [[red eyes]]. Her normal costume consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with a [[detached collar]], a [[red necktie]] and [[black straps]] framing a [[see-through shirt]], black [[detached sleeves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], as well as [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]]. When compared to Type 97 in the original [[Girls' Frontline]], she has almost the same appearance save for the skirt being shorts and her [[midriff]] being visible.

As a result of Jiangyu's Live2D artist posting a non-official "animation":[/posts/5995283] of her doing a [[fellatio gesture]], paired with her outfit, she's often rendered in a lewd fashion in fanart.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7219583: 5* Default

title: kamen_rider_agito
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_agito_(series)|Kamen Rider Agito]], eleventh show of the Kamen Rider series and second of the Heisei generation.

Tsugami Shouichi is a mysterious man who one day washed ashore with no memories, having taken his name from a letter found with him. For some reason he can transform into the mystic warrior Agito to fight the Lords, monsters responsible for mysterious deaths throughout Tokyo.

Agito's default form, [[agito_(ground_form)|Ground Form]], has a black-and-gold color scheme, but can also change forms to suit combat situations - the red [[agito_(flame_form)|Flame Form]], the blue [[agito_(storm_form)|Storm Form]], the fused [[agito_(trinity_form)|Trinity Form]], and the final [[kamen_rider_agito_(burning_form)|Burning Form]] and [[kamen_rider_agito_(shining_form)|Shining Form]]s.

h4. See also

title: jojo_no_kimyou_na_bouken
body:
Known in the west as [b]JoJo's Bizarre Adventure[/b]. 

An ongoing manga by [[Araki Hirohiko]], and adapted into an anime series by David Production. The series is known for its references to Western music, bizarre [[Stand (jojo)|]] powers, over-the-top scenes which spawned numerous [[meme]]s, and the [[fabulous|glam style]] of the characters and [[JoJo pose|poses]].

The anime adaptation is known for its use of written manga-styled [[sound effects]] (particularly [[menacing (jojo)|ゴゴゴゴ (menacing)]]), and for using a western classic song as an ending theme, especially the first two parts' ending theme "[i]Roundabout[/i]":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPCLFtxpadE by the British progressive rock band [[Yes (band)|]].

The story chronicles the adventures of the Joestar bloodline, taking place over many "Parts", each starring a protagonist whose nickname is "JoJo".

h4. List of works

h5. Main timeline

* Part 1: [[Phantom Blood]]
* Part 2: [[Battle Tendency]]
* Part 3: [[Stardust Crusaders]]
* Part 4: [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]]
* Part 5: [[Vento Aureo]]
* Part 6: [[Stone Ocean]]

h5. Steel Ball Run timeline

* Part 7: [[Steel Ball Run]]
* Part 8: [[JoJolion]]
* Part 9: [[The JOJOLands]]

h5. Spinoffs

* [[Dead Man's Questions]]
* [[Kishibe Rohan wa Ugokanai]]
* [[Jolyne Fly High with Gucci]]
* [[Crazy Diamond no Akuryouteki Shitsuren]]

h5. Adaptations

title: shimobey_(mega_man)
body: "An actor robot used in hero shows as the evil foot soldier. Dreaming of someday playing the hero, it always tries to look its best as the heroes beat it up." An enemy from [[Mega Man 11]], found in [[Blast Man]]'s stage.

title: kakyoin_did_you_lay_this_egg_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from "JoJo's Bizarre Married Life", the semi-official [[yaoi]] manga parody of [[Stardust Crusaders]] and one of the installments of [[CLAMP IN WONDERLAND]] by [[CLAMP (circle)|]].

The scene involves [[Kujo Jotaro]] holding a huge [[egg]] in disbelief and ask [[Kakyoin Noriaki]] (who is "married" to him in this manga) if he laid the egg he is holding.

h4. See also
* [[Kujo Jota]] - The child that hatched from the egg in question
